Reviews.Title: “A great all-around deal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Trvl_Lite_10
Reviews.Content: Just did three nights for three in a suite, and it was excellent. The suite was cozy, clean, and quiet. Nothing fancy, but a great price for a great location. Also, the room temperature was easy to control, and the HVAC system was quiet - that can be a rarity at moderate-priced hotels. You have everything you need at the doorstep - train, bus, food, and walking distance to Riverside Park and a little more to Central Park. Little kitchenette (half size fridge, microwave, sink, coffee pot) is great to have and was super clean. Small bathroom, but great water pressure in the shower! Complimentary Wi-Fi worked well. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Shirley H
Reviews.Content: I go to Manhattan twice a year, and this is my choice for a home-from-home, until I win the lottery and can afford Trump International. The location could not be better, as it's just a few steps from the bus stop on 76th and Broadway, and close to either the subway at 79th, or 72nd. I always stay in one of the suites -- since I'm an insomniac, I can go to the living room, read or watch TV, and not disturb my long-suffering husband. No, the hotel doesn't have a doorman or bellmen, but given the consistent value, well, who cares? Breakfast, consisting of pastries, bagels, cereals, juice, some fresh fruit, such as bananas, is often welcome, but life as we know it isn't over if we don't partake, leaving us free to go to Zabar's (a MUST visit EVERY SINGLE TIME -- trust me on this!!!), either the cafe, or the amazing food store, and upstairs for every kitchen utensil known to man is worth it, too! More about the value -- I attend the opera, and many, many of my fellow opera patrons, ones who, no doubt, have much more money than I do, also stay there -- we recognize the Milburn for what it is, and appreciate what it isn't, too -- it's not a place to see-and-be-seen, but we do brag that we're smart enough to know good value! I've reluctantly posted this favorable review, because I'm more than a little afraid that it will become too well known, and I will find it hard to book a last-minute stay, but YOU will be grateful that I was so selfless!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: UWS_Gremlin
Reviews.Content: Great for families - regularly stay here (also on business), pleasant & clean (but not brand new as some others have rightly pointed out). Also there with our three kids summer 2011, catching Hurricane Irene. Staff showed great team spirit by staying put & taking care of the guests, instructions were distributed, service levels upheld. I truly believe that you see the best (and worst) of a hotel when a crisis is afoot & as a guest, you are left in the middle. In the case of Hurricane Irene, NYC, the City that Never Sleeps, indeed took a long nap - all services suspended, shops closed... Great job, Milburn staff! So - what makes this place great for families? Reasonably quiet, central location for subways, mini kitchen easily stocked from nearby Citarella's, Beacon Wine, Zabar's, Fairway's, etc. Helpful & friendly staff (including the breakfast staff - breakfast options may be limited but ever friendly, they always help me out when I am on the go!), sizeable rooms (as some NYC hotels may score high - but the rooms are really tiny & not suited to families).

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall.”
Reviews.Author: mikenco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn one night in February.2 adults,and 1 child.Upon check in,the desk person said we upgraded you to a full suite,,at the same price.Wonderful,I say.We get to the suite,and soon find out that we are on the second floor with no view, and the heater/ a.c. unit outside the bathroom,which hummed audibly.The suite was large and clean.Good furnishings,and we were overall happy with it.I can sleep with noise,lol.The bathroom was so big,I could fit my own in it twice.Everyone was pleasant on the staff,especially at breakfast,which was fine.We would stay here again.Good location,and price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle Island, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: AnastasiaB74
Reviews.Content: February. Parents with two kids. Our room was upgraded to junior suit when we were checking-in. The hotel is quite old but charming. We stayed on the 10th floor (room 1002) and had no problems with hot water or shower. It was too warm in the room for our taste, but it seems that climate control didn't work well. We were staying there for only two nights so we could live with it. The room was big and comfortable. The bathroom was also big and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Mini-kitchen was useful because we bought yogurts and fruit for our kids and could keep everything in the fridge and also make tea for ourselves. Continental breakfast was OK for us: we didn't need anything else but cereal with milk, tea, croissants with cream cheese, yogurts and bananas. The only minus was that we could very well hear the working tv from another room and our neighbors were watching it till 3 a.m. It is a nice hotel to stay with kids: mini-kitchen is very useful, the hotel offer books, CDs, DVDs and games for kids free of charge. WiFi is also free! The hotel is situated in a quite street and you can walk to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park in just five minutes. Many restaurants and shops are nearby. The location of the hotel is great-great-great! It is a very reasonably priced hotel to stay there with your family. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: peter s
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in mid-Feb and loved it! The previous reviewer mentioned the reception staff being rude & unsmiling. We found the exact opposite, they were always courteous, smiling & couldn't have been more helpful! Perhaps it's a case of 'you reap what you sow'? Up on the 11th floor it could sometimes take a little while for the shower to run hot but it was just a case of turning it on a couple of minutes before you wanted to get in once we realized this. I'll never stay anywhere else in NYC from now on! We hardly even went downtown - the Upper West Side is just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: Shoelovest
Reviews.Content: Its kind of old, needs a bit of refurnishing. Old bathrooms, small and old towels. We spent one day there with no hot water, winter time! Reception, oh god!, rude, rude... Put a smile on their faces, please! Breakfast is a joke, right?!

Reviews.Title: “Home-from-home in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: Just back from New York City, staying for a week at the Milburn Hotel. This is the second year we've spent a week there in January. We travel to NYC by train, and the Milburn is just a short subway ride from Penn Station. What a great location; a few blocks from Lincoln Center, across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum and the Guggenheim. For food, you are between Zabars and Fair Way! We were upgraded, and got a very nice big suite. Bed & bedding extremely comfortable, bathroom was perfect, we were on the 11th floor so quite quiet. Very good breakfast served downstairs, 6:30 -10:00. But the best thing about the Milburn is the home-like, relaxed ambience. All the staff are considerate & friendly. The guy in the breakfast room remembered us from last year, as did the front-desk staff. Highly recommended - we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: VickiOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: For our January weekend in New York, we wanted to stay in the Upper West side to be closer to museums and in an area that was perhaps not as touristy as midtown. Based on reviews on Tripadvisor, we chose the Milburn. What a delight across the board! We reserved a standard suite with a king bed, but, although I never confirmed this, I'm pretty sure we got upgraded to a "premium" suite (14th floor). It was HUGE - a great living room area, a teeny kitchenette (no need for it to be any larger), and then a long hall that connected back to a large bedroom with windows on EACH side. There were a total of THREE closets in the suite - more than we'd ever need. A few more details: -There were TWO separate thermostats - one in the living room and one in the bedroom - The bathroom was lovely, although quite small, as one might expect in an older hotel. If a person were of wide girth, they'd probably have a lot of difficulty in it. However, tall people would definitely appreciate the height of the shower head. I saw some reviews about the water not getting very warm. We didn't have this problem at all, although the temperature controls were extremely sensitive. The walls are covered in mirrors in the bathroom, so it does not feel confined. There was a phone in there, too :) - The bed was wonderfully comfortable. There was an iPod dock on the bedside table which I didn't use but was a nice touch -Our girls (12 and 9) slept on the sleeper sofa. Seemed like about what you'd expect from a sleeper sofa, but they had no complaints and slept extremely well. -FREE Wi-fi (say no more) - this is NOT a given in NYC -FREE continental breakfast (standard hotel continental breakfast fare, no better, no worse than other places) - this is also NOT a given in NYC -Two flat screen TVs in suite (didn't use them too much - there are better things to do in NYC) -Room was very clean and nicely decorated. VERY tempting just to stay there... -QUIET - I'm sure being on the 14th floor helped, but no issues of street noise -Hotel employees - every single interaction was great, from the nice man from housekeeping who brought us robes to the helpful people at the front desk (one man spent a good 5-10 minutes helping me to identify a great restaurant that I'd forgotten the name of (Celeste - on Amsterdam - yum!) and the super nice guy in the breakfast room. -Lounge - pleasant and cozy with a fire in the fireplace -Location - GREAT This is my new favorite NYC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGP_12
Reviews.Content: The Milburn Hotel is in a great neighborhood, is really affordable and has a friendly staff. Also, they offer a continental breakfast, which allows you to relax a bit before the day begins. I have stayed here three times when I am in NY for work and have turned co-workers on to it as well. Having a refrigerator and microwave in the room also allows you to buy food in the shops nearby or bring back your leftovers from dinner to have later.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Golden_Mustang
Reviews.Content: We got there by Dec 28, the location is just great, the bus stops at the corner, subway is 3 blocks away, and lots of taxis around. We got one of the first floor rooms which has a moonroof and you push a button and there you go, moon and stars, or sun in your eyes if you wish... The service is good, not bad, not excelent but it was Ok, the one thing got my attention is, when they cleaned the room, they didn't wash the dishes which it was kindda odd. The continental breakfast, well, I wouldn't call it that, average coffe and orange juice and lots and lots of carbs, cookies, croissants, bagels, etc, but don't expect any protein like eggs or ham or fruits either. It was clean and quite, good service from the frontdesk and the good thing, you have a couple of convinient stores very very close so you can use the microwave or the little fridge. Good deal for that price, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on the West Side”
Reviews.Author: Etiole
Reviews.Content: I have been using this hotel for years. It is very convenient....right off Broadway, near Lincoln Center, Zabars, the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. The rooms come with a small kitchenette and the Fairway Market is one block away. The staff are very knowledgeable and helpful. This hotel is a great value. You cannot beat the price for what you are getting. This has kept my family coming back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: B_W901
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was conveniently located on the Upper West Side very near a subway station. The amenities were great (especially the in-suite kitchen) and the staff was helpful and friendly. The only complaint I would have is that it took the water in the shower quite a long time to get warm. I had to let it run for a good 4-5 minutes before it would even get lukewarm. Other than this small issue, it was a fabulous place to stay while in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “location, location , location”
Reviews.Author: brinkKenora
Reviews.Content: On the recommendation of family and friends, my husband and I chose the Milburn for our first trip to New York City and were delighted with the accomodations. The hotel is situated in a wonderful neighbourhood with shops, cafes and fantastic markets, featuring cheeses, breads, deli selections, fresh produce right around the corner...subway stop is 2 blocks away and it is easy to hail a cab when you tire of walking down Broadway. Central Park is a few blocks away along a lovely tree lined route. A continental breakfast of cereal, pastries, and wonderful bagels were available every morning. Our suite, complete with a tiny kitchenette was on the 14th floor and we had a wonderful view of the skyline of NYC. We truly enjoyed our stay at the Milburn and would recommend it to anyone who wanted an old style hotel, with great staff, in a wonderful,residential area of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really good find”
Reviews.Author: TMN10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our friends who are New Yorkers and live very nearby as our usual New York hotel in Midtown has had a 'refurbishment' and almost doubled its prices. It was very nice, quiet and in a more residential area than we are used to. Nice room, old fashioned feel to it and the staff very helpful. Good continental breakfast included in the price, near to a metro station with easy links to all parts of Manhattan, and all in all a good affordable option.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ELESESCAPE_B_AND_B
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is conveniently located to subway, great restaurants a few blocks away and all attractions. Front desk very helpful. Hotel is "tired" and could do with refurbishing, but casually comfortable. The rack rate is high so try to get a deal. Breakfast is basic, bathrooms small but overall an affordable place to tour or conference from.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal in NYC”
Reviews.Author: gene-parmesan
Reviews.Content: We spent a LONG time researching hotels in New York. It's hard to find a good place to stay in Manhattan that is also reasonably priced. Having found the Milburn, it almost seemed too good to be true -- for our family it ticked all of the boxes, and the price was substantially better than just about any comparable Manhattan hotel. We stayed for four nights. We liked the location, in the upper west side and very close to the amazing Fairway Market where you can buy all sorts of fresh produce as well as dry goods and staples. Free continental breakfast every morning and access to a nearby pool were nice touches, but what was especially enjoyable about the Milburn was its unique character. The hotel is older and has a classic feel to it. Our room was large and included a small kitchen; great for making the occasional meal or reheating leftovers. You can request free use of a Playstation for your stay, which our kids happily enjoyed. Being in Manhattan, you are naturally close to transportation links, and within walking distance of Central Park. Being an older hotel, I suppose some travelers might find the hotel a bit dated or tatty. But if you're looking for good value accommodations without having to stay outside of Manhattan, this really is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: FrankDR1
Reviews.Content: Very nice upper west-sider. One block from Broadway. Close to Zabars and a fair amount of night life. 3 blocks to Central Park. (we walked across the park to the Guggenheim). Proximity to Broadway makes taxi hailing a breeze and close to subways too. The rooms are quite large for Manhattan and affordable. The staff was very accommodating, they stored our luggage when we arrived early and also stored it for us since our train was leaving a few hours after checkout. We got a suite and the only negative was that there were no sheets for the pull out couch.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good average accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Histo01
Reviews.Content: Subway or bus ride to city area. Room (studio double) a little small and toilet area very small. We had problems with toilet in one room and relocated to another floor. Breakfast area small. Close to Central Park and good restaurants and shops close by. Room was clean and service from desk staff was excellent. If we visit NY again we would look for something a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Bang for you buck”
Reviews.Author: silvascreen
Reviews.Content: Bags of space in the one-bed suite. Vast (comfortable) super kingsize bed, room in the lounge area for a sofa-bed and a rollaway, big (for NY) bathroom and even an outside terrace -- where I sipped a beer while enjoying the rooftop view and Hudson river beyond. The main rooms were well decorated, though the kitchen (fridge and microwave) area and bathroom are a little tired. Complimentary breakfast is a good way to start the day -- bagels, fruit and coffee. Great location -- close subway, Central Park, excellent food stores and good eateries. Barney Greengrass deli/diner is authentic and good quality. Lane on Amsterdam was v good Thai. All in all, the Milburn is a New York steal for families.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, quiet hotel in a terrific location.”
Reviews.Author: elbrod
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Milburn, and it was better than ever. An express subway ride away from Times Square and Penn Station, it's in a neighborhood with an incredible array of typical New York shops (Zabar's, Citarella, Harry's Shoes, The Town Shop) that offer much more than the more touristy areas. Check in and out are fast and simple, and the room was beyond expectations as I was upgraded to a suite. Free internet, a mini-kitchen, a working radio, two TVs, intelligently configured lighting. A rudimentary (free) continental breakfast could have used some fresh fruit and more healthy options, but it was a nice surprise to have it on offer at all, as was the hot apple cider discreetly available in the lobby in the late afternoon. It's a 10 minute walk to Lincoln Center, 15 to Columbus Circle, a real find for anyone who likes small hotels with big rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jonas123
Reviews.Content: Really nice "older" hotel within walking distance to the subway, stores, food markets (Zabars), Central Park and museums. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the room was very comfortable and clean. There is also a kitchenette with a microwave and refrigerator for those of you that want to eat-in or have leftovers from dining out. The continental breakfast was fine (cereals, breads, etc.). A few complaints: we had no cell service in our room and we were not the only guests with this problem; the kitchenette had only plates, silverware for one person; the hotel does not volunteer the information that there is discount parking at a nearby garage.

Reviews.Title: “Milburn Hotel - Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: YCDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I gave the Milburn five stars. I stayed at the hotel, with a relative, last September and have copied a review I did about our stay on Google Maps: YVRTraveler â€Ž - 22 Sep, 2011 We booked a Standard Studio with Two Twin Beds room from September 12 - September 18, 2011. The room had a kitchenette which included a microwave and small fridge. My traveling companion reported that the internet connection was very good, better than in the last hotel we stayed at in the area. We were happy with the room (for the price), very happy with the location, which is close to Central Park, the subway, Starbucks, a wine store, and Fairway Market closeby. We did not use the microwave but the fridge was handy for juice, beer, wine, and for cold cuts and cheese bought at the Fairway Market. The staff were very accommodating, I asked for a separate luggage stand for my suitecase as the room only had one and the front desk staff found one for me. I requested wine glasses and a corkscrew and was informed that they do not stock wineglass but could bring a corkscrew. The attendant brought both the wineglasses and the corkscrew to the room. The continental breakfast that is served downstairs is adequate, cereal, coffee ... Beds room from September 12 - September 18, 2011. The room had a kitchenette which included a microwave and small fridge. My traveling companion reported that the internet connection was very good, better than in the last hotel we stayed at in the area. We were happy with the room (for the price), very happy with the location, which is close to Central Park, the subway, Starbucks, a wine store, and Fairway Market closeby. We did not use the microwave but the fridge was handy for juice, beer, wine, and for cold cuts and cheese bought at the Fairway Market. The staff were very accommodating, I asked for a separate luggage stand for my suitecase as the room only had one and the front desk staff found one for me. I requested wine glasses and a corkscrew and was informed that they do not stock wineglass but could bring a corkscrew. The attendant brought both the wineglasses and the corkscrew to the room. The continental breakfast that is served downstairs is adequate, cereal, coffee, etc. The staff were helpful and pleasant. I brought along plastic peg hangers and metal over-the-door hooks as I do for all my trips, it came in handy as the bathroom does not have a place to hang the towels. Another recommendation from us, next to the Beacon Hotel, which is nearby is a restuarant, Viand Cafe and has excelllent "home style" meals. Especially the stew, which has large chunks of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Milburn is our place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NinaKPaloAlto_CA
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is probably not for everyone - it is not glamorous, front desk is all business - but it works for us. This is an older hotel (maybe once was an apartment house) that primarily offers two room suites. We were very happy with our upper floor suite. It had a tiny entry hall and then a large sunny living room. Plenty of space for the couch, coffee table, arm chair, dresser and a dining table and chairs . Kitchenette has sink, microwave and frig. and dishes for 4. Both living room and bedroom have large flat screen TV's. Bedroom had good queen bed, dresser, good reading lights. Two walk-in closets in suite. Bathroom is tiny and hard to move around in - but nice toiletries and clean. We had no problems with a buggy infestation (we were there 9 days). (Sorry for reviewer Elizabeth.) There is an adequate continental breakfast - fruit, juice, good coffee, pastries and bagels, etc. Also a new exercise room with equipment. Hotel has free Wi-Fi. Hotel is converting rooms to in-room air conditioning from window units - but windows are openable for fresh air. Location is perfect for us. Walkable distance (easy) to Lincoln Center; on transportation lines. Safe neighborhood feel to area, with Fairway grocery store, small restaurants, and lots of elders, nannies, couples walking around. We don't look elsewhere when we go to NY. We've stayed 3 times and will return.

Reviews.Title: “bug bites”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth E
Reviews.Content: I stayed a weekend at this hotel. I thought it was going to be wonderful and a place I'd go back to. But on Sunday morning I noticed red welts on my body which kept developing over the next ten days. They were itchy & uncomfortable for two weeks. My doctor confirmed that they appeared to be bed bug bites. When I called the hotel (Tuesday) to alert them to the bugs in room 407, they gave me the run around. I left a phone message and an email. I called again the next day and was treated rudely by a manager. Several hours after this call, a lawyer telephoned me and never really addressed my concerns re: what if I brought them into my home.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: D M
Reviews.Content: Stayed Colunbus Day w/e ('11). Very clean, older traditional building, comfy bed, could upgrade towels. gracious staff, great value and location on the Upper W Side. Slept in but heard breakfast was good. Did I mention that I'm picky? Got an upgrade to a suite for the first night! Will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “milburn has it all”
Reviews.Author: kristin e
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to N.Y. for 15 yrs and tried many hotels. But by far, Milburn is the best . Great staff, nice room choices all with kitchens, new gym, late checkout, breakfast, good rates, and close to subway. These are things I love and look for and Milburn has it all. I will keep coming back as long as I'm coming to N.Y. They are my east coast friends and it's home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: My first visit to New York City and we picked a great place to stay! The location was perfect. Not too far away from all we wanted to see and do. Great neighborhood restaurant in Nicks, just down the street. The kitchenette was a nice plus for a 4 day stay. We will definitely stay here next time we get back to New York. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: Madlen392
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our needs. We stayed here for 4 nights in September. We are a family of 2 adults and 4 children: 9,7,5,1. When we arrived, the 1 bedroom suite was all set up complete with a rollaway bed and a crib and even the sofa was made up for us. This was a great start as we were exhausted after being delayed in LA for a day longer than planned. The breakfast was also good. Yes the breakfast room is small but the staff were very helpful and never made us wait more than a few minutes and they always anticipated our need for a highchair. We found the location on the Upper West Side to be fantastic for our family. We walked a lot but we also made use of the subway. Good shopping, restaurants, a food market (just around the corner), Central Park and the Museum of Natural History are all walking distance. The Front desk staff were very helpful with maps and suggestions. We often asked questions! The rooms are a little tight and the bathroom small but we didn't expect much more space for middle of NY and a good price to accommodate our large family. We'll definitely recommend this property to any fellow Australian travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: Legnan0
Reviews.Content: Subject: The Milburn Hotel I recently returned to the Milburn for a weekend of theater and visits with friends. I have been a satisfied customer for years, and this trip only confirmed my belief that the Milburn is the perfect place to stay in terms of value, convenience and staff support.

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Will definitely be back next time we are in NY”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our three kids and it was fantastic. We had a huge luxurious bedroom to ourselves and the kids slept in the sitting room on a double bed and a rollaway. The kitchenette makes it very easy for families - we brought breakfast up from the rather small hotel dining room and ate it in a more relaxed way while everyone got up. In the evening we shopped at the very good grocery store round the corner or ordered take out and ate on the terrace while the sun went down. I think this was amazing value. Biggest tip: ask for a room with terrace. On both our trips we had been allocated a standard room but asked to be given a terrace room and were accommodated both times with no extra cost. I have to say that - with one notable exception - the desk staff were pretty grumpy but they were perfectly efficient and it didn't cause any problems.

Reviews.Title: “New Yorker Welcomed Home”
Reviews.Author: E D
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Manhattan and chose The Milburn because it was on the Upper Westside. It was great! Great location and convenient to all modes of transportation, especially the subway and buses. A hop, skip and a jump to Times Square, downtown and uptown, Eastside and Westside and all around the town. Friendly, helpful staff. Most comfortable beds. Tasty Continental breakfast. Great value. Busy but colorful neighborhood. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel we will stay”
Reviews.Author: pnktypn
Reviews.Content: I don't understand why this hotel is so underated. All of staffs are very friendly and helpful. Lobby + the room we stayed (one bedroom suite) are beautifully decorated and super clean. The space of each room (bed/living rooms and bathroom) is huge and very comfortable - worth spending extra $. Kitchenett is a bit small, but who cares since minimum amenities are in place and dining out is one of the amusement of Manhattan anyway. Breakfast is simple, but offers good selections. Coffee tastes great! The location is also fantastic. Since we love upper west side in general, we did enjoy walking in Riverside Park or Central Park early in the morning like local residents. Fantastic options come with the hotel, but price we paid is quite miniumum. Must say rate is very reasonable and competitive which we also love. The only regret is that we had to make early cancellation due to family emergency. But visiting NY is our anual event, and now we know where is the place to stay in future. No more searching required. Thank you Milburn for the great experience! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: elevation
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at this gem on Upper West Side. Excellent service, helpful front desk, Fairway Market closeby for some groceries, Chrupring Checking for an excellent chicken meal. Enjoyed occasional bagel (free) for breakfast. Do yourself a pleasure, and stay here during your NYC stay. No, you wont get airmiles, or other points.. You do get great service at reasonable prices, and large rooms. Stefan

Reviews.Title: “great set-up for the price”
Reviews.Author: mcubed61
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Milburn for just 2 nights mid-August on a quickie visit to NYC. Had not stayed Upper West side before and found the location to be relaxing, somewhat residential, yet close to shops, subway, etc. Our room wasn't large, but adequate space for the time we spent there. The kingbed was little soft, however that certainly is person preference A tiny kitchenette was included with dishes, microwave, sink, coffee maker & fridge (handy to cool that bottle of wine). A continental breakfast was included, but crowded one mornng with limited choices. That doesn't matter when there are plenty of places to grab a coffee or snack right around the corner. We had beautiful weather and walked to MoMA in about 30 minutes, through Columbus Circle, down Broadway; very pleasant. The next morning we walked a few blocks then through Central Park to reach the Metropolitan. The desk staff were friendly, and informative. They stored our bags for us all day since we had an evening flight. Something we learned, due to union rules, the housekeeping staff does not clean dishes--so wahs out your own coffee cups! A taxi ride to LaGuardia was only 20-30 mintues, traffic dependent. We would definitely stay here again. Wi-Fi capable with accesss code in your room. Small exercise room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: wmutunga
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night over labor day. They don't send a confirmation email, so there is no way to know if your reservation is confirmed. When calling to confirm, the lady didn't even wait to hear the question, just confirmed the reservation then hang up. It's clean, reasonably priced. We got two twin beds rather than one king bed. Very firm beds!!!. We didn't try the complimentary breakfast, since checkout was 10AM. We'd stay there again, just in a king bed.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to N.Y., Perfect Location, Great Room, Helpful Staff, Such Fun.”
Reviews.Author: geoffrey V
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is a mid-sized hotel on the upper West Side. A Subway stop is just a couple of short blocks away, Fairway grocery store is two blocks away; a good overnight dry cleaner is right next door. We had a suite on the 13th floor that was very clean and had a great view of the city. The suite had two large flat screen TVs and a small breakfast nook, with refrigerator and microwave, cabinets furnished with plates, glassware and silverware -- very convenient. Every morning, a small continental breakfast was served, with bagels, toast, coffee, orange juice, sweet rolls, and fruit. Restaurants in the area are plentiful and within a couple of block's walk. Lincoln Center and War Horse is just a 15 minute walk. The Natural History Museum, Central Park, and the Metropolitan Museum of Modern Art are all within walking distance. We never had a problem catching a cab at any time, day or night. Even more important, the staff at the Milburn was always friendly and helpful. For a first time trip to New York, I would recommend the Milburn!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, terrific location, terrific room.”
Reviews.Author: KMMDC
Reviews.Content: I had appointments both mid-town and in Harlem. I was traveling solo and took Amtrak up from DC. The Milburn was welcoming, quiet, a little Bohemian, and a lot of character. I was able to make all my appointments by cab or by subway with only a few blocks walk. I was close to discount shopping at Lohman's and some cute specialty boutiques. Many good restaurants nearby, also several good markets to buy your own. Adam, at the front desk was a terrific help with concierge as well as a wicked sense of humor.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in a fantatsic part of New York”
Reviews.Author: 415GerardC
Reviews.Content: My wife, 1 year old daughter and I stayed here for 13 nights this month and it was absolutely fantatsic. We had been planning our New yprk trip for many months and wanted a hotel which was reasonably priced, at least for New York, was in a quieter and safe part of town and was easy enough to get around the city from. The Milburn was perfect as the the Upper West Side was a delight and there were 2 fantastic supermarkets within about a block for supplies and the hotel breakfast although often crowded which meant a slight wait on occassions saved a heap of money rather than eating out each morning. We stayed on the 11th floor and it had already been upgraded with new air con which worked great on the hot days and I think that most of the building has probably been done as they were doing the 8th floor while we were there and I noticed a few people complained about the old air con on trip advisor. The streets around this place are spectacular if you like archiecure like I do and I would recomend just walking around and looking up. Some of the Borwnstones around 81st street were superb but there all over the place if you look. If you have little ones our daughter loved the children's museum of manhattan so much we had to go twice and there are a heap of great playgrounds at Riverside part just a block away of in the other direction the Tecumesh playground is just a block over but only open after schools hours as it is part of a school. The free wirless also worked a treat as we had an Ipad, Iphone and Blackberry with us and having free wifi in the hotel saved afortune in phone charges for downloading emails and also helped with downloading some Dora episodes for my daughter when she got bored of being dragged around to tourist sites day after day. Would highly recomend this place and can't wait to get back and explore the city some more as 13 nights just wasn't nearly long enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location”
Reviews.Author: buffaloali
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious, and free wifi! Couldn't get a better deal and in a great location. Definitely heading back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rude management, did not keep reservation”
Reviews.Author: SLG2222
Reviews.Content: Did not give us the room we reserved-- like something out of a "Seinfeld" episode. I had reserved a 2-room suite with a door, so that my child could sleep while we could be in the outer room with the light on. I called 2 weeks before to confirm my reservation. Upon arrival, was told by the manager (who was very rude and defensive) that I had been "upgraded" to a more expensive and larger ONE ROOM with 2 twin beds and fold out couch. They even tried to charge me more. We were forced to stay in that room the first night (with much insistence, they gave me a "reduced" rate, equal to that of the original room I had reserved). The next day we were moved to the room we had originally asked for. Breakfast was mediocre, and there was often a wait for a table (so not a good choice if you are in a hurry). The swimming pool is at a nearby JCC that requires swim caps, which are not easily available unless you bring your own, so be forewarned. The neighborhood is nice and the rooms fine. We got parking, but there is no guarantee so best to arrive early.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very friendly staf!”
Reviews.Author: ellen0505
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is situated in a very safe, nice, green area, 2 blocks from both Central Park and the River banks (sensational sunsets!) with supermarkets, shops and restaurants nearby . 2 mnts walk to the subway. Rooms are very clean and the small kitchenette is a plus. Breakfast is basic, but sufficient to start a long day of sightseeing. Lobby and business center very convenient and the library looks as if you're at home. During our stay we had an urgent medical situation with my daughter and Adam, at the front office, reacted very adequately, involved and responsible; we are still very grateful to him.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in New York City”
Reviews.Author: FayTeller
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Milburn Hotel for several years and the hotel has upgraded the rooms and lobby areas so nicely. The staff is friendly and helpful and it feels like home to us now. Each accommodation has a kitchenette which is great and there is a very nice breakfast included. The hotel is in a terrific location. Close to Lincoln Center, The Museum of Natural History, Central Park and much, much more. The subway is two blocks away (the best way to get around the city) and there are buses everywhere. We love the Milburn!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Mannings1812
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several weeks at the Milburn Hotel and found the staff friendly and helpful, the lounge calm and relaxing, and there was free coffee on tap for much of the day. The kitchenette was well-equipped, although the Upper West Side is full of restaurants so we didnt self-cater as much as we had planned. The rooms on the ground floor are particularly nice, and the stereo and IPod player/charger were nice touches. Definately a home away from home. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a few nights, good location and value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Kemmu
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Millburn is a bit like a visit to your Grandmaâ€™s house; everything is there but just rather fading and shabby and need of renewing. After a day or so, it doesnâ€™t seem to matter too much and the good location on upper west side and the relative value kind of make up a bit. We had a suite at the back of the hotel which had a small kitchen area with fridge, microwave and sink which was useful. We went out for breakfast across the road each day and had supper in a local Italian restaurant a couple of times. Plus the very excellent West Side Market is just round the corner with fresh fruit, prepared meals, everything you might want. .

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anyplace else in New York!”
Reviews.Author: carla60430
Reviews.Content: The Miiburn Hotel is the only place we stay when visiting New York. It's location on NY's Upper West Side puts it close to shopping, transportation and a wealth of restaurants, bars and entertainment venues. (Lincoln Center is just a few blocks away). However, we love it best because of the level of customer service offered there. From the moment you enter the immaculately clean and inviting lobby you know this is the kind of place you want to be. Check-in is always easy and efficient. The staff is courteous. Details always appear to be important. Not to be ignored is the comfort in the accommodations. All rooms come with a mini-kitchenette which can save any travelor some cash. The beds are comfortable and made with very good quality linens. The surroundings are quiet and a good night's sleep after a day in the city is always a reality. The bathrooms differ in size depending on your room, but all that we have had are clean and well-stocked with towels and toiletries. I am convinced that you cannot beat The Milburn.

Reviews.Title: “Works great for families but a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: Goven
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel is great for families enough room, easy access to subway and groceries/restaurants, clean, friendly staff,etc. But...our room was a bit worn and in need of an update. The AC in the bedroom was so loud. The bathroom is extremely cramped with no place to put stuff. Perhaps a few shelves would help. The kitchen was poorly stocked with only a place setting for two(even though we booked for five) no sharp knives, no toaster, not enough glasses, etc. The breakfast is the same thing day after day bagels and breakfast cereal. The toaster there is so slow and does not brown on first attempt so you hold up the line up. The room is so small it is hard to get a table and the staff manning the front door although very gracious have a hard time sitting people. Some yogurt, cheese,etc would add some variety. Free internet is provided but at the same time often you could not log on as "there were too many subscribers). At the same time hotels nearby do not offer breakfast, do not offer free internet and do not have such a great(quiet location) with good access to everything. So I would still recommend the Milburn.

Reviews.Title: “perfect weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jeanmcf
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Milburn for a girls wekeend in June & were pleasantly surprised. Our room was roomy & spotless with a beautiful view. We can't say enough about the staff! Everyone we encountered was pleasant & helpful. We have found our home away from home! Jean, Kelly, Kathy & Sarah from Allentown PA

Reviews.Title: “What happened to The Milburn?”
Reviews.Author: greatsteinways
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Friday, June 10 and were given a two-room suite on the top floor of the hotel. We have stayed at the Milburn before, so we thought we knew that it is a decent, quiet, well-situated hotel, but it has gone seriously downhill. We were very tired as we had just come in from London, and when we opened the door to the rooms, we were overcome by a very strong mildew and mold odor. We turned on the AC in hopes of airing out the rooms, but the two separate AC units were too inadequate to do anything about the strong smell or even simply cool the warm, musty rooms. One large closet next to the bathroom seemed to be the main source of the smell. We informed the front desk of the smell, but we were not given a clear alternative. Against our better judgement because we were so tired, we decided to spend the night. Other problems then became apparent. The shower faucet handles were not secured to the shower wall leaving large gaps where anything could crawl through, and later that night a large bug did appear in the bathroom. We left early the next morning for a cleaner and safer hotel. The only good thing was we were not forced to pay for more than the one night we stayed, but over $300.00 for a smelly, buggy room with bad plumbing and no real AC is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: diegojaimo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed with my family (wife and 1 and a half year old daughter) 7 nights in May. The hotel was with full occupancy but there was no problem to make an early check in. The room (a studio) was very clean and spacious. The breakfast was correct, very good bagels. The neighborhood is very nice and quiet. I love UWS. The best of all: the staff. All of them were very kindly. They gave me support in all I needed. Obviously, I'll return to Milburn in my next visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: conradw
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Milburn to us. What a great little hotel in a great location! We were booked in a large mid-town hotel initially but canceled it once we researched the Milburn a little more. We had three adults and two children (6 years and 3 mos) in our studio room. It was a bit tight, but only because we had to move the crib around a bit during the day. The kitchenette was a life-saver and the free breakfast was excellent. We stayed for 7 nights. In the lobby of the hotel is a nice sitting room with a few bookshelves of books for kids and adults. My 6 year-old would go downstairs every morning to return the books she grabbed the previous day. She loved this part of the day and we were very happy to be able to provide her with lots of reading options without having to pack all her books from home. The front desk also has a small DVD library with a good selection of family-friendly titles available to check out for free. The Milburn's location is fantastic! Just a few blocks down from either the 79th St or 72nd St Metro stops. If you would rather take cabs, the hotel is only half a block from Broadway where you can grab a cab anytime of day within a minute. We were able to go from our room to a Broadway show within 20 minutes! Within just a few blocks in either direction are numerous restaurants, grocery stores, a couple of wine/liquor shops, pharmacies, and anything else you would need. Central Park is just a few blocks to the east and Riverside Park is just a block and a half to the west. I've stayed down in mid-town and downtown and I have to say the surrounding neighborhoods in the Upper West Side are not only safer but everyone is friendlier and much more helpful. Our studio room was clean and roomy. The beds were very comfortable and the overall noise level was very low. We had a south-facing room on a mid level floor so it faced the back of another building. We slept with one window open about six inches every night and we were never disturbed by any street noise--something quite remarkable for NYC! The bathroom was clean and everything worked without any problems. The kitchenette was very nice and came complete with silverware and dishes. Only inconvience during our stay was that one of the elevators was under repair for a couple days. This wasn't really a big deal since the hotel is relatively small. Free wi-fi is also included for as many devices per room as needed--this was a nice bonus! The staff were all very friendly and knowledgeable. Overall the hotel was very family-friendly. I highly recommend The Milburn for families looking for a well-appointed, family-friendly hotel in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - Milburn Hotel NYC - 72hours cancel”
Reviews.Author: Upperwest1
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents and uncle into this hotel to stay over memorial day weekend. My father had a car accident and they could not make it. I called to cancel 5 hours beyond the 72 hours and the hotel asked for copies of the hospital discharge, and tow records. I had my parents faxed the documents and I still didn't get a refund. and I live in the neighborhood. Big mistake on my part trying to be a good neighbor and booking with them, their rates are not that much less expensive than the Hilton in midtown. I am never recommending this hotel to anyone who comes to visit me, and I have lots of friends internationally and in the US. Management of the hotel just loss 1000s dollars of potential revenue in exchange for 500 dollars cancelation of two rooms I booked with their 72 hours!! cancelation clause. If you're thinking of booking, please look around with the rates, you can get a location closer to midtown attractions. I was stupid to think about being a good neighbor to book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: steve_222_222
Reviews.Content: It was clean and the personnel were accommodating and it was only a stone's throw away from where my daughter (whom we were visiting) lives in NYC. On the downside, the room was layed out poorly with the only comfortable chair UNDER the TV rather than across from it. The air conditioner was obnoxiously loud and made it hard to sleep. The shower was an adventure in being alternately subjected to hypothermia and being scalded...it would not hold a consistent temperature for more than 2 minutes. Public restroom quality toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite hotel on UWS”
Reviews.Author: EthelSue
Reviews.Content: We had reservations at the Wyman house, but she cancelled on us, so one month before our trip we searched for another one bedroom suite on the UWS. We had walked by the Milburn on previous trips, knew the location was ideal, so booked a suite. The experience was positive from the first phone call. The representative was very helpful in answering all of my questions about the lay out of the rooms. We arrived early (before 2:00) and our room was ready. The suite was clean, quiet, and spacious! The wi fi was fast enough for our needs (free). We had a few housekeeping needs. We needed more glasses, plates, silverware....they were delivered within the hour. Our corkscrew broke while opening a bottle of wine....we took it to the front desk.....they sent up a maintenance person with pliers and a new corkscrew...and saved the bottle of wine! A plug got stuck in the sink....they rescued it. The air conditioner units are a tad noisy, but they were white noise for sleeping! The elevator was slow, but not terribly. We are not big breakfast people, so their continental breakfast (bagels, cereals, pastries, juice, tea, and coffee) were more than adequate. The gentleman in charge was exceedingly pleasant and called me by my room number (with a smile) after my first visit. The only negative is the coffee provided in the room is awful (several other guests had the same evaluation) and there is no good coffee available until 6:00 a.m. in the breakfast room. I would strongly recommend this hotel for its location (walk to Central Park, Riverside Park, 5 blocks to subway) for a great visit to New York City.

Reviews.Title: “great location, quiet room, front desk help weak”
Reviews.Author: Rubi5
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a good hotel but the front desk people need some serious advice on customer service. We arrived early in the day and asked if the front desk representatives if there was any way we could hang up my husband's suit so it would be ready for a formal event that evening. I mentioned that my husband had been traveling for a week and we really needed to assess the condition of his suit. The front desk rep told us to wait until 3 pm for our room. I asked to speak to a manager and was told he was in a meeting. I then pressed the issue and asked for a hanger and a place to store the suit along with the luggage. I was told there was no place to hang a suit for him but then I noticed a coat tree in the area behind the reception desk and asked to use that area. After more discussion, I was given a suit hanger and the suit was hung on a coat tree in the area behind the reception desk. Late that night we tried to use the internet and called the front desk for help. We were told to call another number and were charged $1.25 for the two calls we made to the help desk. Had we known of the charge we would have used our cell phones. We needed to check out a day early, on Friday. Late Tuesday night before reaching the hotel, I called the hotel to let them know of the change of plans. I was told I was too late to avoid a penalty as there is a 72 hour notification time period. When we arrived at the hotel I again asked about the charge for leaving early. On the second attempt to learn more, I was told that if the hotel could sell the room, we would not be charged and that we would know Friday morning whether we had to pay for Friday night. Friday morning no one at the front desk knew anything about our request. We returned after breakfast and a young woman explained that although she did not know the status of the room, we should vacate the room and maybe it would sell. We were not leaving NYC until late that evening, but we packed and left the room as she suggested. When we returned around 4 pm we learned the room had been sold so we did not need to pay for the third night. The room was on the interior courtyard, was quiet, with windows that opened. The bathroom had no shelf space but was adequate. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was bleak. But the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: MDNA
Reviews.Content: If you're interested in a well worn dirty place with bugs (I didn't identify them} and a staff that is disinterested in making you feel comfortable....thjis is the place to stay! Oh yes, if you want ice and go to the basement ( a spooky place at best).make sure you bring a saddle. the rats are large enough to ride.

Reviews.Title: “DISCRIMINATES AGAINST THE HANDICAPPED NO SERVICE DOGS ALLOWED!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: handicapped61
Reviews.Content: Even the police couldnt convince the gm that assistance dogs are allowed to stay at any hotel; they still broke the disability act law and sent me away on a cold Feb night after first saying yes, charging me, making me bring bags in, and then changing their minds after they called gm of hotel. Shame on them. Lawsuit pending.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suites great for a family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1202, a superior one bedroom spacious suite. We were happy with the room and the service provided by the hotel staff. As a family of 4 it was the perfect location. Lots of great restaurants and close to central park. We stayed at the hotel the day after the big blizzard for 2 nights (as our flights were cancelled and we had to leave the apartment we had stayed in the last 10 nights) AND still thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel!”
Reviews.Author: azallie75
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to NY to see a show. The hotel that we booked had water damage from the stom that day so we were refered to the Milburn. We checked in late in the evening so we were kind of stuck. Yes, while the lobby was somewhat lovely the staff was cold and rude. The room was even worse. Room 205 was dingy and obviosly hadn't been renovated in years The noise kept us up most of the night. It felt like a skanky roadside motel. Had it been earlier in the day we certainly would have left. My suggestion is to shop around. There are so many nice hotels in NYC and for the same price you could surely find better. There were seedy people hanging around the lobby late at night....didn't quite know what to make of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location...the Milburn has it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: BS101
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Milburn Hotel on the Wednesday night, exhausted after hitting the rush hour traffic from JFK! The lobby of the hotel is warm and welcoming and the staff are super friendly. We checked in and got directed to our room. The room we booked was a one bedroom suite as there was four of us travelling, the youngest of whom is 19. The room was great. It had a really spacious living room with a big double pull out bed and a flat screen tv with digital and dvd player and all. Off the living room there was a tiny kitchenette, and I mean tiny, but it had a good size fridge and there was a coffee maker and microwave there, plenty for what we needed. The bedroom had two good size double beds with two wardrobes and again a huge flat screen tv with the digital cable and dvd player. It also had an iPod docking station where you could play your iPod or the radio, this came in really handy for charging the iPods we had with us! the bathroom was located off the bedroom, it was small in comparison to what I've come across in Ireland, but no smaller than anything you would see in places like Paris and Barcelona. After reading previous reviews we kind of had a good idea of what to expect of the hotel and the surrounding area. The first night we went to a local diner which served great food, there are plenty of them around the Milburn, and all really good value! The first morning we were a little bit hesitant about the breakfast, we had read that it was one of the downfalls of the hotel. Much to our surprise and delight we found that the breakfast was more than sufficient. There were six different types of bagels, two cereals, juices, teas, coffees, and even a selection of croissants and other breakfast cakes. There really was a good selection, and you could help yourself to as much or as little as you want. One thing I would say is get down to the breakfast early, we found that if it was any later than about 7.45am the queue was really big and you ended up wasting valuable sightseeing/shopping time waiting to get a table. The room isn't huge so space fills up pretty fast. the hotel is located in the perfect area with a good mix of residential houses and shops. There's a Sephora literally across the road at the opposite side of Broadway, it's not as big as some of the others that you will find in NYC but it was still great, and had practically everything there. It was really handy too for just popping in on the way home from anywhere. On our final day the hotel minded our bags for us as we wanted to get a few last minute things done. If you want to use the Subway the nearest stations are on West 72nd and Broadway and West 79th and Central Park West, the 1,2, and 3 routes stop at 72nd street and the local trains stop at 79th. Get a week pass if your there for anything more than 3 days, theyre great and you save loads! Also the Fairview shop nearby is amazing! It has everything you could ever need or want, they even have Barrys Tea and Cadburys chocolate if your feeling any way home sick! Its an amazing place even just to go and have a look in! Nick's Diner is definetly worth a visit....really good value food....place is really cool with loads of messages all over the walls! It's really popular with the locals too which is always a good sign! Another great thing about the hotel is that they have WiFi all over it! It was really handy to be able to go on the internet on my iPod touch from the bedroom to check things like weather and times of buses and Subways! Definetly worth bringing something that can connect to the net! But there are two or three computers with internet access in a room off the lobby as well! Overall the Milburn was a really pleasant place to stay with really friendly staff and a great location! I would definetly go again!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Bliss”
Reviews.Author: skbplus4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Milburn for 5 days over the Thanksgiving week with 3 teenagers. We were very pleased with our stay. Staff was helpful and friendly. Complimentary breakfast was good. Hotel is conveniently located, clean and priced well. Free internet access, boarding passes were printed for free, free movies from front desk and overall a great place to stay. We would definitely stay there again. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Upper West Side Location, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cardsfaninchitown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend in NYC for fun. It was our third time their in the last few years, having previously stayed in Midtown. I wanted to experience a different neighborhood and so chose the quieter Upper West Side, which is a short 10 minute commute to Times Square and a short walk to Central Park. When it comes to hotels, we usually stay and basic, clean places in good locations. That is exactly how I would describe the Milburn. For NYC standards, it has larger rooms and a mini-kitchen which is nice for saving a few dollars. Our room was clean and the bed comfortable. The hotel staff was courteous, and they have afternoon coffee/tea in the lobby- a nice touch. The small breakfast room was crowded, so we went out for breakfast at one of the many nearby cafes. The subway is 4 blocks away. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: plspoon
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Milburn in room 404. Our friends spent 8 nights there in room 400. We had no problems with our room, it was a reasonable size, comfortable, clean and in good nick. Our friends had some problems with the shower in their room. At times, the cold water kept cutting out leaving you liable to be scalded. The staff here are not overly friendly, not actually unfriendly, just not as welcoming as you might expect. However, once we were there a couple of days and started chatting with one of them, they turned out to be not too bad after all. The breakfast was very disappointing. Downstairs in the corner room, out of paper cups and bowls. Tiny packets of cereal. Only bagels, no bread. We didn't bother after the first day. Bought breakfast supplies at one of the WONDERFUL supermarkets on Broadway. Fairway or West Side are GREAT. They have everything you could require. For dinner they even have freshly pre-prepared meals for $5-9 which you can take back to your room and eat using the plates etc in the room and the microwave if you need to reheat. I can assure you they are not the frozen TV dinner variety, these are proper meals, good sized and freshly cooked. The cheese counters are to die for! If we had not been travelling with our friends we would have probably eaten in almost every night and tried all the lovely stuff from the supermarkets! Back to the hotel.... it's about a 5 minute walk down to 72nd street where you can get a 2 train non-stop to Times Square (5 mins?) or a 1 which stops all stations (6-7 mins?). On Amsterdam Avenue there are numerous pubs and restaurants. We ate twice at the Amsterdam Ale House. This is straight down 76th street across Broadway and on the corner of Amsterdam. Reasonable priced food. Wine about $9 a glass which from the UK and Aus seems rather expensive. All in all, this hotel is in a quiet location but close to the subway, restaurants, Central Park, Riverside. We would stay here again (just to visit the supermarkets....) Free Wi-Fi in room although it did drop out at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hutais
Reviews.Content: We are relocating from Sydney Australia with two young children and this hotel has really been great. Its not fancy but it is clean and a great location. Everything is in walking distance that you would need . The Upper West Side is just lovely and very kid friendly. Will recommend all my friends coming over to NYC to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Long Fall Weekend in New York”
Reviews.Author: WanderingGirl1
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with our stay at the Milburn. The room was clean and comfortable. The air conditioner was a bit noisy so we kept a window open. We stayed on the 10th floor. The place has a slow elevator. We only ate the continental breakfast 1 out of 3 days. The offerings were nice; juice, coffee, bagels, toast and coffee cakes. The location of this hotel was wonderful. The free WIFI and computer lobby were great also. We flew into La Guardia and took the M60 to Broadway/110 and then took the 1 line to 79. It was a 3 block walk down Broadway to the hotel. It was also a quick walk to the 72nd street subway too. Central Park and Riverside Park were both short walks away. We caught the M5 bus at 72 also to go the mass at St Patrick's Cathedral. We also ate at several places in the neighborhood like Big Nick's Pizza, Niko's, Sarabeth's, The Amsterdam Ale House and Cafe Viande.

Reviews.Title: “It's seen better days....If you aren't desparate for a suite, you'd be crazy to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wjs
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Milburn a number of times because our daughter goes to school nearby and it offers suite style space when we travel as a family of four. Rooms are obviously still spacious and convenient upper west side location doesn't change, BUT: we booked this trip six months in advance, and when we arrived we were put on the 2nd floor despite request for a higher floor. We were placed in Room 201 which had the dining room directly underneath -- people began dragging chairs underneath us and setting up breakfast at the crack of dawn, and an electronic garage door opened and closed all night under our window -- like having a blender turned on next to your ear. We checked the room carefully for bedbugs when we first arrived-- when we lifted the covers to inspect, mattress looked quite worn and saggy with holes in it. We kept our fingers crossed it was just old and worn... Bathroom was beyond cramped and had mildew stains on ceiling and floor -- hooks were broken off so there was no where to hang anything, and sink ledge was too tiny for anything more than a toothbrush, several lightbulbs were burned out in the room, no plastic bags available in closets for dirty laundry. Rooms have tiny kitchenettes -- since the bathroom was so tiny, I used the reflection of the microwave oven to brush my hair and put makeup on! Heater was hard to control and noisy. Good news about 2nd floor was that we could take stairs to avoid slow elevators, but the stair well was dingy. Front desk staff was brusque and chilly though we've stayed there a number of times -- not sure what the issue is there, but it comes across as attitude of some sort. Breakfast room was hot and overcrowded with choice of sugary cereals or sad bagels. so-so coffee. We skipped it after day one of our three night stay. There was free internet available in the lobby with a pass code from the front desk which was nice. Seems to cater to one time international tourist crowd that doesn't necessarily know better. Needs a major spruce up and customer service refresher!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MidtownMike62
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Milburn 4 or 5 times over the last 12 years. It has been a few years, however, and some negative online reviews made me anxious about this stay. Little had changed, I'm glad to say. That said, the emphasis is on value, not top-end quality. Nearby grocery stores coupled with a refrigerator and microwave and inexpensive restaurants and the Milburn's spacious suites make it a great choice for families, which is how we used it before. The great neighborhood, nearby Riverside Park and Central Park are big pluses. Negatives are very small bathrooms, sometimes noisy steam pipes and a bit of a pinch-penny attitude. Still, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Upper West side”
Reviews.Author: m0m2g0
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with my teenage daughter. The room was spacious, with 2 comfortable beds, a table and chairs, and a kitchenette. There is a 24 hr. market just steps from the hotel with an amazing deli, and anything else you might like to eat. The hotel was quiet, clean, and well-located. The included breakfast was barely adequate. They offer free internet as well as computers off the lobby for guest use. Overall a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: rbellaj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at for 8 nights in September. Decided on the Milburn after one of the NYC forum experts recommended it. We were originally going to stay in Times Square for almost twice the price and I am so glad we didnt! The Upper West Side is beautiful, you definately get more of a feel for being a new yorker, great restaraunts nearby, subway 3 blocks (less than 5 min walk), Central Park took about 10-15 mins. Hotel did great breakfast (excellent bagels!), free internet, both wireless and they have a 3 station business centre. My only complaint, mentioned by previous reviewers is again the aircon is very noisy, found it hard to sleep so could not leave it on during night which became pretty hot. The elevator is also annoying, there are only 2 old ones and we happened to be on the top floor! I would probably stay here again, although I would research other hotels on the upper west side too. So happy we didn't stay in midtown/times square!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: moorejjbb
Reviews.Content: You know, I really didn't want to spend $250 per night for a hotel room in NYC and if it were just me, I would have chosen a significantly less expensive place for the two nights I was there. But my 70+ mother and 16+ daughter were with me and I had to think of their comfort. The Milburn fit the bill--very well located, spotlessly clean, spacious, comfortable, very nice staff and great amenities (free wifi, free computer center, nice lobby, free continental breakfast). The bathroom could have used some updating but there was nothing actually wrong with it. We booked a large king-sized room (surprise! it had a kitchenette!) and they said they would put a cot in for my daughter. I was expecting a thin mattress and a rollaway, but they brought in an actual, low bed with a nice thick mattress and box spring. Amazingly, the room fit it and it wasn't all that crowded. My only complaint is that with 3 women sharing the room, there weren't enough mirrors outside the bathroom for all our hair and makeup needs. Bottom line--excellent value. Glad to have found it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in west side New York”
Reviews.Author: moonflower59
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights in Milburn Hotel September 2010 after Trip Advisor recommendation. Great value for money, older style hotel in safe, affluent part of NY. Loved the free wifi and great restaurants nearby. Room was clean and cosy, bathrooms clean but showing their age. Free breakfast was juice, fruit, 2 cereals, fresh bagels and coffee. Bus stop very close, subway a few blocks away. Took forty minutes to walk to Times Square or 10 minutes in the bus. Staff on duty varied from superb and helpful to very average.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely, clean and great situated. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_2Cat
Reviews.Content: For a short or longer stay, you will like this hotel. To expensive for me as I travelled alone but as they had a discount I had to try it. Had such a wonderful stay! It was my second time in New York. I actually wanted the same hotel as last time but the Milburn had an interesting discount. Breakfast is included and really basic, but available. Staff is always friendly and ready to help you, advice you. New York is known for small rooms but I was surprised of the great size. Nice bathroom, big flatscreen tv, I-pod alarm, kitchenette, microwave, fridge, iron and ironing board. There was also a lounge sofa. Gave the room a luxureous feeling. Situated in a nice safe area, subway at 72 and 79 St nearby, several supermarkets and a lot to see and shop on Broadway if you want to walk to 42nd Street. It is not down town but down town is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “My new "goto" hotel for the city”
Reviews.Author: bjj127
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with my stay at the Milburn as compared to other places in NY. The staff was friendly and helpful. They gave advice on parking and things to see, offered to help with our luggage. We had booked a studio but were upgraded to a one bedroom suite for no additional charge, so our room was quite spacious. Just the bedroom portion, which I assume would be about the size of the studio, was roomy by NYC standards, so I'm sure we would've still been happy even if we hadn't been upgraded. Our room was spotless with nice soft linens (which I ripped off partially to check for bedbug signs - didn't see any). And of course being close to Central Park and not too far from Times Square is key. Upon checkout they offered to store our luggage (a service we didn't need on this trip, but have wanted in the past). No place is perfect, of course. The bed was too soft for my taste and squeaked terribly. The bathroom was microscopic (the suite had two closets - all the room we had and some couldn't have been devoted to the bathroom?). The air conditioner in the living room portion was older and had a slight musty odor, but it wasn't overwhelming and we got used to it. The elevator was extremely slow and creaky. Overall the good far outweighed the bad and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “how disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sherillhb
Reviews.Content: The hotel's lobby has been rredone since my last visit years ago, but the rooms are not as clean and certainly not as well equipped. The air consdtrioneer, which is a necessity during aNew York heat wave was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good price, but needs a little clean up!”
Reviews.Author: walk_wander_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week, and I must say it's a striking contrast between the kindness of staff - always helpful and ready for a chat, with complimentary coffee in the lobby, free internet, basic breakfast - versus the room we were given... second story out of very many (in a NY building!), no view, old carpet all over the place, tiny bathroom that definitely needs to be redone from scratch. It must have been very pretty once, but now it does need a little revamping. I would advice it basically for the reasonable price and the position!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded, convenient, warm, still could use a bit more work”
Reviews.Author: stevemusic
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Milburn for years! I consider it my home away home when I travel to NY. It is truly one of the warmest and most reasonable hotels in the city. It was refreshing to experience upgrades of continental breakfast, lobby internet, lobby, plasma screen and internet room......Still a few upgrades are in order: the bed I slept in was very soft and uncomfortable. (I suggest a survey of beds, and replacement). The kitchen was less equipped as in the past. The microwave did not work....If a certain element of protein could be added to the breakfast (perhaps hard boiled eggs) it would be wonderful. I am saying these things not to "complain" but to simply say to the Milburn Hotel " if you are upgrading, you should go all the way!". I will stay here again, and hope to see improvements.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: CynBand
Reviews.Content: My soon and I stayed at the Milburn Hotel for about 16 days. It was great ! We loved the location. Quiet, good staff and a very good neighborhood. After a shopping day, itâ€™s perfect to rest. The room is clean, bathroom small but all right, and kitchen is helpful. Some days they cleaned the dishes. Other days no. Thatâ€™s all right ! If you need a mini cooker, they provide, but bring detergent and a sponge as they are not provided. In the basement you have ice machine for guests and a coke machine (not available when we stayed there) If you need laundry, after 17h00 the hotel allowed guest to use the hotel's washing machines. You have to pay U$ 6 to wash and U$ 2 for dry. It worth it. The machines is big ! Take your soap powder ! You can buy it in the market, just around the corner. In the lobby always have classical music playing. Very pleasant. The gests are mostly from Europe and US. Very familiar ! Internet is free. You can use the hotel computers (there are 3) or your laptop, Ipadâ€¦. Including in the room ! To smoke, I went outside the hotel. At 3h00 or 4h00 is all right. No danger !! Half a block to the right and half a block to the left, you have supermarkets, 24/7 both of them. Fresh fruits and everything you need. A few steps on Broadway, you have the best ice cream I ever ate! In the other side of Broadway, corner with 77St. you have Manhattan Diner. Fantastic ! Good price, good options and the best: 24/7 In the corner with 72 St. there is a metro station. Go to wherever you want. To come back with a cab is not expensive. From ground 0 to Hotel, something like U$ 20 If you donâ€™t like big tourist hotels, and prefer a local good option, I strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great value, A Little Updating and It Would Be Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cade_avery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn for 3 nights with 2 of our children, ages 9 & 8. We loved the location, it was on a quiet street, very close to the subway and Central Park. The lobby was very nice. The room was fine. The room had plenty of space, but the bathroom was small and everything could have used some updating. A $1,000 of updating in each room could make a huge difference. The room was pretty clean, the blinds needed a good dusting and the oldness of the bathroom/kitchen made them seem a bit dingy. Having a free breakfast in the hotel was great. The breakfast area is small, so you have to wait in line for a table. We didn't realize this the first day and arrived downstairs about 15 minutes before we had to leave the hotel to catch our ferry. The line was too long to wait, so we grabbed a bagel and headed for the subway. The next day we did breakfast in our room, and the last day, we waited for a table. If you want to eat in the breakfast room, allow some extra time in the morning. (Although since all rooms have tables in the room- you can easily eat there without a wait.) The employees were great. We asked the housekeeper for extra towels with our tip each morning, and she always left more than our request. We asked the front desk people about parking, and one of them came outside with us to give us advice. Bottom line- we would stay here again, especially with our kids. It was a great hotel for families. One tip- check the parking on the street outside the hotel. When we arrived, there was a space across the street from the hotel. We parked there to check in, and it turned out to be a legal space. You had to move your car between 11-12:30 on Monday and Thurs, but we arrived Thurs. at 12:30 and were leaving before Monday, so we got free parking for our entire stay. And it was great having our car right there across the street where we could get into it whenever we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price hotel, surly staff”
Reviews.Author: Incedo
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel for the price and location, a little shabby but nothing too serious. The staff, with one exception (staff in the breakfast room), were surly though not unhelpful. Then again maybe that's just New York - what do I know? Other points to note are that the air con is noisy, otherwise the rooms are quiet, the breakfast is what you would expect (good bagels) and the kitchen is as expansive as a Glasgow salad.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for My Needs”
Reviews.Author: chippie
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in the Hotel Milburn in the heat of July.
