It was clean, the AC, though noisy, kept the room as cold as I would want, the bed was very comfortable, the location was wonderful, and the staff were all friendly. The option of grabbing a quick breakfast proved to be fortunate; the coffee was almost strong enough for me, the bagels very tasty, and the cereal and banana option were all i desired. In addition, there were pastries, juice, and probably other bread to toast. I felt extremely safe at the Milburn. My particular room was okay -I'd scored a very cheap Hotels.com room rate which put me in a less classy room. But, it was absolutely fine, clean, large, quiet, and so on, as I said above. I met others at my conference who were in more nicely appointed rooms-yet we all agreed we'd easily come back to this hotel in the future. It was an easy walk across town to our work, and there were gobs of restaurants to choose from right nearby. It's also very convenient to all the public transport. Yes to Hotel Milburn.

Reviews.Title: “Milburn Hotel- spacious room & great location”
Reviews.Author: KenKY
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Milburn Hotel, located in the upper west side of Manhattan. We had a queen suite- large bedroom, living / eating area, bathroom, and a small area with mini frig, microwave, coffeemaker (plates, silverware provided). While the hotel is somewhat "dated", the room size more than made up for that for us- based on all the reviews of tiny NY rooms seen elsewhere. The Milburn is in a residential area, so if you want to experience how the locals live, it is a great place. Around the corner are markets to get food if you want to eat in your room. Many restaurants in short walking distance. Central Park is also just a few blocks away. The 72nd/73rd Street subway is short, quick walk and we used it a bunch. If the 2 or 3 express train is used, Times Square is the next stop- just minutes away. Continental breakfast is provided- bagels, cereal, fruit, etc. We enjoyed out stay at the Milburn and feel is was a good value and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “A good option in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gbjames
Reviews.Content: The Milburn was a good choice for my wife and I because of the proximity to the subway, Central Park and the nice Upper West Side Location. We got a good deal through hotels.com although I do feel that when you book through a rate consolidator like that you don't get as nice a room as when you book directly with property. Our room was on the second floor with no view and the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. It always take a few nights to get used to a window air conditioner, too. The bed was fine and the room was clean - we spent very little time in the room so it was fine. The continental breakfast was fine and the staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away from the Madness”
Reviews.Author: loneoak75
Reviews.Content: The Milburn Hotel, located in the picturesque Upper West Side residential/commercial neighborhood, will provide you a good value and a more authentic NYC experience. But if it's the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the theatre district you want, it's only a five-minute subway ride away. Express subway lines only 3 blocks away, and it's only one stop to Times Square. Room was spacious by NYC standards, more than compensating for a teeny-tiny bathroom. The kitchenette proved very handy over a week-long stay. Hotel is old but clean and charming; service was prompt and efficient; and front desk was helpful. Best attribute of all is that for en entire week, we never heard a peep -- no motel noise, no street noise, no sirens, no nothing. (And, no, we weren't alone in the hotel.) Bed was very comfortable. AC worked well. Internet connection was reliable and fast. Hundreds of restaurants and every kind of store and service imaginable within walking distance. Everything is a little cheaper here than in midtown, so why not use this as your base for exploring the city?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a family with more than 2 children”
Reviews.Author: GvilleHistoryTours
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours trying to find a hotel in NYC that would accommodate my family of 6 (children 12, 6,4 and 1) without any luck. It seemed everyone but the most expensive suites either would not take over 4 people in a room or would charge excessively for extra persons. I started looking into renting condos or apartments for a week but was scared off by the horror stories and scam scares. I finally found the Milburn and it was exactly where I wanted to be--near Central Park. The room was more than I've ever paid per night ($270), but was WELL worth every penny. The room was huge...a large, nicely appointed living room with a sleeper sofa, desk, tv, sitting area and a dining room table. The 2 queen bedroom was also very large and nicely done with a decent sized bathroom. The storage closets and small kitchen with sink and fridge were also big bonuses for traveling with family. My family had easy access to parks, stores, and the subway. We loved being so close to 2 local grocery stores and a good choice of restaurants nearby that were very reasonable. I also loved that they had a playstation with games (free) for my kids and a library to check out books for them as well. All this and to even have a free breakfast too! We really loved our stay there and the staff were very helpful to us. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. ...and...it was not far from the Shake Shack and Gray's Papaya, which became 2 of our favorite places to stop for quick, good, cheap food. ...and parking was very reasonable ($25 per day) with a stamp from the hotel for a nearby Hertz parking garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Karabiber
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for stays in NYC. I have stayed several times and have been very satisfied. The design might be a bit dated, but it is very reasonably prices, in a great neighborhood, close to the subway. The room size is quiet nice for NYC standards and they have a fridge and a small kitchen corner, which is great for having a small meal in. Furthermore, the hotel has free wireless and a free breakfast, both not to be taken granted in NYC. Central park is just a few blocks over, as is Fairways a great supermarket. I did not try the room service, but prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: darneke
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is an incredible value -- we paid just under $200/night after taxes. It's a quiet, impeccably clean, well-run place. Our room was perhaps twice the size of a typical, tiny NYC hotel room, nicely furnished but nothing trendy. The service was flawless. The location offers the opportunity to experience a New York residential neighborhood, and a lively but quiet one, at that. It's an easy walk from the 72nd Street subway stop. Lincoln Center, Central Park and other places of interest are walkable. The Beacon Theatre and Museum of Natural History are right in the neighborhood. Close enough to Times Square and anywhere else you might want to go, but just far enough away to be a very pleasant area. Some people might find it a little out of the way, but that's one of the best things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Right Hotel Right Place Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Badpacker
Reviews.Content: Being a bit confused about where to stay in NY; we booked this as it seemed value for money and other reviews were positive. It turned out to be inspired. Really nice neighbourhood that wasn't touristy - just local shops, bars and restaurants. Subway 2 blocks away, Central Park on the doorstep. The hotel itself was fresh and clean, our room was enormous with a kitchenette, sofa, arm chair, huge TV and really nice bathroom. Staff were kind and the breakfast was served until 10am so no need to get up early. Taxi back from downtown about 20 dollars at night. You can get everywhere from here easily so why pay high prices for tiny rooms in touristy hot spots? Check out the amazing diner nearby ( you can order their food on room service but best to go yourself )

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: flanneur
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. However the hotel turned out to be better than I feared. My room was spacious and comfortable and the small kitchenette was handy to have for when I did not eat out or to make some coffee etc. The breakfast was simple but included in the cost. I was given a good rate and the front desk service was good too. The hotel is in a very handy position, close to transport and lots of restaurants and food outlets.Also it is in easy reach of Central Park and Riverside Park. Free use of the computers too.My only downer was that the airconditioner was noisy. For the price and the area , I can recommend it for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Is there a better spot in all of Manhattan?”
Reviews.Author: coalroller
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New York with a 10 and 12 year old, wanted a little more space and were recommended to this hotel by a friend who lives on the upper west side. I suppose there are those who might say the place is dated, and perhaps it is. But dated isn't bad. We are just used to new hotels. We spent 5 nights here in a one-bedroom suite. We had a king bed, the kids a queen sized pullout. We didn't much use the kitchenette, but did appreciate the fridge and microwave. The place, dated or no, was very clean. We had nice beds with nice, clean sheets and plenty of good towels. The cleaning was good each day. The breakfast (very good bagels, cereal, juice, fruit and coffee) was a nice touch. I didn't even know it existed before check in. The staff was all friendly and helpful. To the person complaining about cancellations - I get it, but it is spelled out pretty clearly. Last minute cancellations would hurt. For us, the space and location trumped all. The neighborhood feels comfortable and safe, and walking to the museums, the park, places to eat or the subway is quick and easy. I'd go back tomorrow. Downsides - perhaps a little facelift? Carpeting could use an update. And the a/c (window units only) was pretty loud. We loved that you could actually open windows, though. Anyhow, this place was a real gem. And, travelling with kids, the extra space was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay, but terrible experience with reservation”
Reviews.Author: Beader36
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but I had an experience that I want to warn other travelers about. I made a reservation over the phone. The very next day I cancelled the reservation (also by phone). Since I had given my credit card information, I wanted to be sure I was not charged as a no-show, so I asked the reservation agent to e-mail me a confirmation on the cancellation. He rudely refused to do this. I subsequently e-mailed the General Manager three different times requesting a simple reply e-mail to confirm the cancellation. All my requests were ignored. As far as I know, I have not been charged anything, but this kind of treatment reflects very badly on the hotel. I would not stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable, and great location”
Reviews.Author: Somervillemom
Reviews.Content: We had a 2-double bed room rather than a suite, yet the room still had a tiny kitchenette with microwave, minifridge, place settings, coffeepot. The double beds were definitely doubles, not queens, which was an issue for my 2 kids (one is actually a teenager), but the beds and pillows were very comfortable. The room was extremely quiet at night --- no street noise, and I only heard a door close once the whole time we were there. One thing to keep in mind if reserving a room rather than a suite -- the rooms are right next to the elevators on each floor, so ask for the one furthest from the elevator. As I said, our floor was extremely quiet, but I imagine it could be a problem to be right across from the elevator. The lounge is very nice, as in the picture, and is stocked with a variety of books, including a nice selection of picture books for kids (but the lounge has some breakable things and is so nice that it's hard to imagine really little kids in it). We had no problem getting breakfast when we went down for it, but we got up late, so maybe we beat the crowds. The bagels were bland, but there was plenty of food and fresh fruit. Some parts of the hotel seem kind of old, such as the elevator and the font on the sign, which seems to be from the early 1970s. But the room was nicer and more comfortable than I'd expected for the price. (We paid the same price for a room with 2 Queens at a La Quinta near Times Sq two years ago.) The hotel has discounts at nearby restaurants. We ate at Niko's across the street just before we left the city, because it was convenient, and although we didn't expect much, we all enjoyed the meal. (It ended with a free dessert, dessert wine, and a balloon for our youngest.) The staff was very helpful, and we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room after checkout time. The hotel is a short walk from the Hudson River, which is a nice place to take kids or go for a romantic stroll. We drove in via the Henry Hudson Parkway, and parked in a garage in the low 70s, then left the same way, a nice entrance to the city if you're driving.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at Milburn was Great!”
Reviews.Author: Lee4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our NYC trip and stayed 4 nights at the Milburn. We stayed here about 1 1/2 years ago b/c we were taking our then 2 1/2 year old son with us and wanted "suite" type accommodations that were affordable. Since our first stay was so great, we returned this past week and were just as satisfied as the last time. This hotel is perfect for traveling with kids! Our one bedroom unit had a living room with a small kitchenette. While the kitchenette area is very tiny, it's still so handy b/c of the fridge and microwave. Having the extra space with the living room is a real plus to us so that we don't have to go to bed as early as our son, and it's also nice to be able to spread out and relax a bit more while in the hotel. The suite was clean and comfortable; I think they've all been renovated recently with new TV's and the bedding seems better now as well--much more comfortable than what I recall from the last time. Housekeeping and other staff (nice front desk workers!) were always friendly and helpful to us as well. The 72nd and 79th street subways are just a few blocks away in either direction, there are lots of restaurants nearby, and there are 2 grocery stores basically around either corner. Central Park is also a short walk away. There are also drugstores and other shopping in the area. Being on the UWS puts you in a real NYC neighborhood, which means it's family friendly and easy to get things you might need during your stay. I recommend this hotel highly for anyone traveling with family. We'll look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Reasonable Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nosaat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Milburn twice in the last few weeks. As everyone has commented, the neighborhood is wonderful and very convenient. It's one subway stop to Times Square, two to 34th Street. Within a few short blocks you have Loehmanns, Filenes, Urban Outfitters to name a few. It's a short walk to Lincoln Center. The hotel itself has its pluses and minuses. The rooms seem to be a mixed bag. The first room I was in had 2 closets, a very comfortable bed, a nice marble bathroom (with bathtub), but the water pressure in the shower wasn't great. To be honest, I didn't ask them to fix it, so it might have been a temporary problem. The second room had great water pressure, but the bed wasn't as comfortable, and the bathroom had a cheap formica counter and storage. The rooms were both were clean and well equipped with a small refrigerator, utensils, kitchen sink, small table and 2 chairs, an armchair and ottoman, and a flat screen TV. The best part for me (besides the location) was the other services offered by the hotel. There are 3 computers for guests' free use in a room off the lobby. I believe that the hotel also offers free wifi, but I didn't bring a laptop and access to the computers made things much more pleasant. There was a small exercise room that I didn't get to try. The hotel also offers a free continental breakfastâ€”cereals, bagels, fruit, pastries, coffee, tea and juice. This meant that I didn't have to go out in the freezing cold before coffee, or buy things the night before and sit in a hotel room to eat breakfast. I've done that in the past and while it's not terrible, I much preferred this set up. A tip--Expedia and Hotels.com offered a discount for booking 4 nights or more, while the hotel itself didn't (I tried). Bottom line: I highly recommend the Milburn. It's not fancy or luxurious, but it's a good place to stay at a reasonable price in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Much to like, but beware the reservations policy”
Reviews.Author: piedmont62
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is very comfortable in an unfancy way (the rooms are like small city apartments with average furniture), well located (unless downtown is your focus), and--a big plus--the staff is great (extremely courteous, very helpful) and several have been there for years. They try to accommodate requests. The lobby, although small, is pleasant for conversation. The free breakfast is "continental" but, uh, free. My only knock on the hotel is their rigid cancellation policy, which in some cases starts to resemble a scam. You have to make ANY changes (including the number of nights you will stay) at least 72 hours in advance. To repeat: you cannot arrive for a 5-night stay and at check-in or later tell the hotel that your plans have changed and you will stay only 4 nights. You have to change the number of nights 72 hrs. before arrival. If you don't, you WILL be nailed for the original number of nights. They may make noises about trying to sell your room (i.e., helping you sublet!) to someone else--but this won't happen! You're paying the 5 nights. However . . . with this one caveat (which I've not found to be the policy at any other hotel I ever stay at), I do recommend the Milburn for the spaciousness of its rooms, the good views from many of them, the convenience of the kitchenettes, the staff, and its very walkable location (the Park, the River, restaurants, the 72nd St. subway stop).

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bassandkeyboard
Reviews.Content: We stayed (family of 5 in two suites) for a week and were vere happy. Clean well-equipped rooms, good breakfast. Upper West side location is perfect for families with good transport connections and a nice quiet area with good shops, restuarants and facilities. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience with some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ccbbSeattle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Milburn for 3 nights during the week of Thanksgiving. I had requested a quiet room and we were very pleased with the room we got. It was on a top floor and was very quiet for Manhattan. We liked having a kitchenette with a sitting area and we also had a private balcony with a nice view. Other positives: The bed was comfortable and we liked the free wireless service and the kitchenette. The room does not have a stove, but you can request a hot plate and pots from Reception. The bathroom needed updating but was just fine with enough room for our toiletaries. The housekeeping service was excellent. The continental breakfast was a perk as was the fitness room. They also offer a free pass to the JCC one block away. And the hotel is located in a wonderful neighborhood, close to great restaurants, cafes, Central Park, and the subway. There were a few things that I did not like about the hotel. The rooms do not have individual thermostats and are heated by radiators. When we first arrived at our room, it was quite cold. I called the Concierge who had me check the unit. It had been turned off and he told me to open the valve to generate heat. The temperature was fine for several hours, but we woke up in the middle of the night because it was sweltering in the room! So we realized that the radiator had been turned off for a reason. We ended up just leaving it off for the rest of our stay, which was fine once we figured that out. The radiator also made periodic hissing and knocking noises -- survivable with ear plugs, but somewhat annoying. Our bed linens had a stain and the blanket had a hole. The refrigerator was not working properly. Even at a low setting, it froze the beautiful salad greens that I had bought at Fairway Market and I had to throw them away. These are minor things, but they started to add up and for the price we were paying, I expected better. My biggest complaint is with the hotel's cancellation policy. The Milburn requires that you cancel by midnight 3 days prior to your arrival date. So if you're arriving on a Wednesday, you need to cancel by the Saturday night before. I reserved online and got a confirmation email. It was not clearly stated that you must cancel by midnight prior to the 72 hour period. I tried to cancel our reservation 3 days prior to arrival but neither the Concierge nor the manager with whom I spoke agreed to cancel the reservation. I left a message with the hotel's general manager and with the accounting office, but nobody ever returned my calls. We decided to keep our reservation to not lose our first night's deposit. Overall, we had a pleasant stay at the Milburn except for the issues described above.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sarah05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milburn for 5 nights over NYE. Hotel is in a great location, a short walk to several metro stops. Plenty of restaurants and markets only a few minutes walk away. We were in a studio room with a king bed. The room was very spacious compared to others I have stayed at in Manhattan. The bed (which was super comfortable) and flat-screen TV appeared to be newer additions to the room. The tiny bathroom could use updating but was perfectly fine and functional. The hotel was very quiet, never heard any street noise. The free in-room high speed internet was a plus. I would certainly stay at the Milburn again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably-priced in nice Upper West Side location”
Reviews.Author: ggl44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spacious, clean suite with comfortable beds and a kitchenette. The hotel is quiet; not a place for rowdy guests. The staff were friendly and helpful; we had a self-inflicted non-emergency problem but staff responded to our call within 15 minutes. The hotel is in a very nice, safe neighourbood with restaurants, subway, Central Park, and the Museum of Natural History within 3-4 blocks. It's a 10-15 minute subway ride to Times Square. We would definitely be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good rooms and good value”
Reviews.Author: ShorthouseScot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milburn just before Christmas. Our room was on the top floor with a door which opened on to the roof and gave us our own private view of the New York skyline - brilliant. Our room was very spacious and had everything we needed, including a small kitchen and dining area. We were several floors above street level, so it was quiet, too. The hotel is handily placed for Central Park, the Museum of Natural History and the NY subway. On our first day we simply walked out the hotel, took a turn on to broadway and kept walking until we reached the bottom of Manhattan. There were a number of good diners nearby for breakfast. We wouldn't, however, recommend the Mediterranean restaurant on the corner of West 76th and Broadway - tasteless food and rude staff. Overall this hotel was exactly what we wanted - comfortable accommodation at a decent price in an interesting neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and great location, great comfortable beds and nice lobby”
Reviews.Author: missgVermont
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying on the upper west side and my friends first time. They are now convinced that this is the place to be in NYC. It is so convenient to the subway, great cafe's, decent street vendors, fabulous markets and stores and the museum and park. The beds were so comfortable and the warmed cider available in the lobby was great. We had a small suite and the kitchenette was perfect to bring leftovers back. We loved the stay and the location. 'Gail in Vermont

Reviews.Title: “our second stay here... just right”
Reviews.Author: MendoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six great nights here, enjoying the neighborhood and the city at large. Our room #305 was a small suite; kitchenette, living room with big TV, closet and dressers; and the bed/bath about the same size, both with actual windows that actually can be opened, if only a few inches. Service is relaxed and attentive. Coin laundry in the basement. The neighborhood is great: restaurants, stores, Zabar's deli, and all-night fantastically well stocked market. Walk several blocks N or S on Broadway to access the subway. Central Park and the Natl History Museum is a few blocks east. If you stroll across the park from here you arrive at the Metropolitan Museum and a raft of other smaller museum gems. Daily maid service, 24 hour front desk, our home when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “For a miserable experience, try the Milburn Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: CoachMikeT
Reviews.Content: Avoid the Milburn Hotel on New York's upper west side at all costs. It could end up costing you plenty. My reservation at the Milburn was for Friday, Sept. 18. On Monday, the 14th, I phoned the hotel to inquire about the cancellation policy, which would have been unnecessary had I received a copy of the policy by e-mail or snail-mail. The person I spoke with told me it was three days in advance of the reservation. She also used the phrase "72 hours," which, from my travel experiences, is a synonym for three days. So, because my plans were uncertain at the time, I chose to wait one day based on the conversation, especially since the confused clerk did not tell me that the deadline for canceling was Monday. When I called Tuesday -- three days before I was scheduled to check in -- to cancel because of a family matter, I was informed it was too late. The front-desk clerk I spoke with said to contact the general manager on Wednesday to discuss the situation. I left repeated polite messages with the general manager on Wednesday and Thursday. He refused to return my calls. So I stopped by the hotel Friday morning before leaving town, and the general manager told me the matter had been turned over to accounting and to contact them. For the next eight workdays, I phoned the hotel and asked to be switched to accounting. Each time, I received a recorded voice and was asked to leave a message. Each time, I left a polite recording -- eight of them -- yet never received one return call. It was obvious that the continuous lack of returned calls from the general manager and accounting was an effort by the hotel to ignore me, hoping that I would go away. Finally, I phoned the hotel and requested to be switched to anyone in accounting. I got a live voice who told me a refund or full credit would be considered. My occasional pestering finally got a response after a few weeks. I was informed that no refund or credit would be granted, only that an unspecified "rate" might be considered on my next reservation with the hotel. Are you kidding me? So I'm out $339.13, plus hours of my time dealing with the most customer-unfriendly hotel general manager in a lifetime of travel. There are plenty of good hotels in New York. Most have a one-day cancellation policy. They send you their policy upon making the reservation. Their reservations clerks explain the policy properly. And, if a problem arises, they are courteous and reasonable. The Milburn is none of those. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, nice location, good price, a little outdated”
Reviews.Author: Justinpianoman
Reviews.Content: The price is good and the location is too. We got a free upgrade to a bigger room since the hotel was not full, so that was nice. WE got a little kitchenette, sitting area, two tv's, etc. The room was a very nice size for NYC. It definitely needs updating....but overall a good experience. also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Quiet, pleasant hotel for independent travelers.”
Reviews.Author: ChartreusedeParme
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Milburn for three nights in Nov. 2009 and we were throroughly satisfied with our stay. We booked a suite rather than a regular room after reading the reviews on this site, since only the suites could be guaranteed to be renovated as of the date of our stay. The upcharge was not substantial, and was well worth it. We had no problems at check-in at 6:00 pm on a Friday evening, and the staff was consistently courteous. Our rooms were in the corner on the eighth floor, and it was one of the quietest urban hotel stays I have ever had, despite being in NYC. There was some street noise, but nothing from within the hotel itself. The curtains kept the bedroom very dark, too -- good for late sleepers. Not everything seemed up-to-date -- it is an older hotel -- but for the price we found nothing substantive to complain about. Be advised that our bathroom was very small, with almost no space to set out toiletries, though it was clean and modern. If you have a hanging toiletries bag, or some other method of keeping your things at hand without placing them on a counter or shelf, you might want to bring that along. The kitchenette was also very small, but handy. We both found the king bed as comfortable as at home. Other than price, location was the main reason we chose the Milburn, and it was a good choice. The hotel is located in a pleasant Upper West Side neighborhood, just off Broadway. (But it's still extraordinarily quiet.) Local families were very much in evidence on the streets the weekend we were there. We love to walk, and we walked almost everywhere we wanted to go -- restaurants on two of three nights, the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Frick Museum (just across Central Park), Lincoln Center for the opera, and Midtown shopping. On our last night we had dinner in Greenwich Village -- an easy, direct subway ride away. When we did need a cab, it was easy to flag one on Broadway a half-block from the hotel. We thought the complimentary breakfast was going to be a real advantage at the Milburn, but, though it was fine (coffee, tea, juice, cereals, baked goods, some fresh fruit), we think we would probably have been happier breakfasting at the Manhattan Diner a block away. Next time we'll plan on that: they serve breakfast all day. If you're an early riser and like to get a cup of coffee and a bagel first thing in the morning, however, you'll appreciate not having to go out for breakfast. We will definitely stay at the Milburn on our next trip to New York, and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable rooms in great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Grendel_9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Milburn several times. It's not fancy, but it is quite clean and comfortable. It's more like have an apartment than a hotel room. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are enormous by NYC standards. Most hotels charges four times as much for anything resembling this much room. Our bathroom was a little cramped and the refrigerator in the kitchenette worked more like a freezer, but that was a minor incovenience. You get an in-room coffee pot with enough coffee for two small pots, a necessity for me in the morning. I need lots before I get dressed to go down to breakfast. The complimentary breakfast (a recent addition) is rather bland and uninteresting, but the bagels were good. You can get a great hot breakfast from Manhattan Diner just a block away. It's a quick walk or they'll deliver to the hotel. I wish the Milburn was a little closer to Central Park. It's an easy walk, but I got spoiled years ago by the Olcott (now closed) which was less than a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel... great staff”
Reviews.Author: Desert_dweller48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at this wonderful small and quiet hotel on the Upper West Side. It is located close to two subway stops and Central Park. The neighborhood is mostly residential. Lots of great restaurants are with close walking distance. The room was very nice. It was clean and appears to have been modernized. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third time at the Milburn. Consistently good and a solid value.”
Reviews.Author: PN_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for months. Our family had our third stay at the Milburn this past summer and can report that it remains one of the great values in NYC. The staff was helpful and friendly (as it has always been), the refurbishing of the lobby is delightful, and the rooms -- while not new -- remain clean and somewhat spacious for a NYC hotel room, especially for the price. For us, staying in NY means not spending much time in our room. Too much to see and do. The Milburn serves as a perfect spot for our family of four to enjoy all that NY has to offer. The neighborhood (upper West Side) is delightful, with loads of interesting shops, markets and delis. And there are subway stations two blocks in either direction. For the price, I think the Milburn is terrific deal. We look forward to returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “good value in nyc if you want to stay out of busy downtown”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: The Milburn offers good value for stays in NYC. The building appears to be an old apartment house that has been coverted to a hotel. We had a 2 room suite for less than $300 in NYC. The bederoom and living room are quite large. The bathroom and kitchenette (sink, refrigerator, coffee maker and microwave) are small. Everything was quite clean and well-maintained. There is a continental breakfast included in the rate. The hotel is right off of Broadway and a short walk to the 72nd Street express subway stop to everywhere else. It is a healthy walk to times square. It is a very good location to stay if you are visiting Columbia, Barnard and other UWS colleges. There afe lots of restaurants in easy walking distance. Apparently they have delivery room service arranged wih some. Parking is discounted at a garage about 3 blocks away...if available. If not there are other garages.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker_North
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience New York fully and to have a quiet place to sleep with a reasonable price, this IS the place. I booked through Expedia, which gave me 35% off of the room. Central Park and Riverside Park are just a few block away. My husband and I enjoyed a free kayaking on Hudson on weekend. As far as dinning options are concerned, I would recommend delis at Zabar's or Westside Market. You can get all kinds of wonderful meals in a very reasonable price. I would recommend purchasing 7-day regular Metro Card ($21), which takes you everywhere in NYC via subway or bus. The hotel gives you a day pass for the Jewish Community Center pool (one block away to the east). It has a great facility and would have a chance to mingle with locals. I was quite surprised how courteous New Yorkers are â€“ including the staff at the Milburn or people on the subway. Yes, the hotel has a bit of maintenance issues and breakfast room can be busy at a time. However, I would not hesitate to book this hotel when I go to NYC next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Caitybee74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn for 10 days with two small children and my elderly mother in law. ROOMS: Were great, We stayed in a one bedroom suite which has 2 very very comfy double beds in one room and a sofa bed in the other. The rooms were spacious with TVs in both rooms, full bathroom and kitchenette. We spent a lot of time in our room as one of our son's were ill and did not get cabin fever. The kitchenette is not very well equipped but the staff were always happy to provide anything you needed. The bathroom may be a bit on the tired side but it was clean and the rooms were serviced daily. LOCATION: I cannot fault this location especially for a family with small children. This hotel is not in the heart and hub bub of downtown so you do actually feel comfortable wandering around at any hour to the 24 hour grocery store around the corner. While being out of the craziness of downtown you are only 1 subway stop (on the 2 train from 72nd street) away from Times Square. You are on the same line (the 1 train from 72nd street) as the ferries to Staten Island and Statue of Liberty, You are a couple of stops from the Museum of Natural History (a must esp the planetarium) on the M79 bus from 79th Street. You can walk to downtown - it took me 20 mins to get to 58th street and you are a couple of long blocks from Central Park. The shopping in the local area is great - a Barneys around the corner, a Loehmans one block down and a Filenes Basement on the cnr of 79th street. The local restaurants are adequate. THE SERVCE: I thought the staff were great. As mentioned our son was ill and they were very helpful with information about Drs etc. The free breakfast is a great bonus and am not sure what the previous reviewers issues were about - you have a choice of cereal, fruit, pastries and bagels, tea, coffee, juice and water. If you want more than that I suggest you go elsewhere and put your hand in your pocket. Yes sometimes there was no room left in the dining room but this was rare and easily solved by picking your time or taking your selection back to your room to eat. We had no problem with getting any assistance including having a town car booked for our return trip to the airport on our behalf. For the price of this hotel I think you get excellent, above expectations value. I could not recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel ideally located”
Reviews.Author: VegasRulesOk
Reviews.Content: The Milburn was one of the few hotels we found which included breakfast at a reasonable price. Located on 76th street just off Broadway Ave the Milburn is just a few minutes walk from Central Park with the subway available just a few blocks away at 72nd & 79th street. Breakfast consisted of bagels, cereals, fruit, juice, muffins, cookies, tea and coffee and was served in a small dining room close to reception. This did get a little crowded depending on what time you arrived but you could always grab something and take it back to your room as many people did. There were 3 free Internet terminals available; you just needed an access number available from reception, which gave you 30 minutes free access. There was also a small gym, a library and free access to a local swimming pool just a block away. To obtain the free access you asked reception for a pass for which you needed id. To use the pool you were required to wear a swimming cap. The staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful and the room we had provided a good-sized bathroom as well as a decent sized bedroom/kitchenette area plus a safe. Tea and coffee making facilities were supplied along with a microwave. There was a DVD connected to the TV and a library of free films was available from reception. Overall a great place to stay if you want to be reasonably close to Times Square but in a quieter area. There were also plenty of places to eat close to the hotel. If we go to New York again we would very likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Excellent Value, Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: Other Trip Advisor reviews didn't fail -- I was very happy with this hotel choice for my first visit to NYC. I found it easy to navigate my way from Newark Airport, using the train from the airport to Penn Station, followed by a quick subway ride and a 4-block walk. Easy! The hotel's location is terrific. The Upper West Side is a wonderful neighborhood, with lots of good, reasonably priced restaurants and a variety of shopping. It felt safe, friendly, and was a quiet respite from the frenzied pace in other parts of the City. I had the Milburn's smallest accommodation, the studio, but it was by no means tiny. I found the room size to be generous, with a comfy chair & ottoman, dining table & chairs, and 2 closets (one with a safe) -- and I loved the convenience of the kitchenette. The bathroom was small, but was clean, well organized, and bright. The bed was extremely comfortable, with great pillows and nice bedding. There was a large, flat-panel television with excellent station selection. In early September, I did need to use the a/c during part of my stay, and I thought the window unit was noisier than it should have been. However, I was also delighted that the room's large window could actually be opened, and when the temps cooled down, I turned off the a/c and enjoyed the fresh air, instead. The hotel was completely full during my stay, but I never heard room noise, and the lobby was busy but peaceful. There are several computer workstations for travelers who don't bring a laptop, and use is free (as is the in-room wifi). The continental breakfast included bagels, pastries, coffee, juice, fruit -- you could easily start your day with it, but on a couple of mornings, I chose to go for a full breakfast at one of the nearby restaurants. I found the Milburn to be comfortable, friendly, and a good value for New York, and I loved the Upper West Side neighborhood. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Shrekyboy
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in New York city - we were there for 8 days and loved every minute of it. The Milburn Hotel was located very well in the Upper West side. Handy to Central Park, Museums & the Metro. The king sized bed we had was extremely comfortable. The flat screen TV was a nice feature as well. We selected this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and by a friend. The price was right for NY and the location was quiet. However, you do get what you pay for. My complaints are the following: I rely on the internet for my job, and that is one of the reasons that we chose the Milburn - being free was a bonus. Basically it was unbelievably slow when it did work at all. When I called the front desk, they told me to call the company that provided the service, however they didn`t know the phone number. Stay elsewhere if this is important to you!!! The bathrooms were small and in need of an extreme makeover. The air conditioner worked, but it was so noisy I couldn`t sleep for the first 2 nights until I got used to it. The free breakfasts that were included were a joke - little boxes of cereal or bagels. The coffee was lousy too. Other than these complaints, it was acceptable accomodation but I wouldn`t hurry back. We changed hotels after 5 nights

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service - great accomodations - one warning!”
Reviews.Author: NDGFamily
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four - kids 8 and 12. We spent two nights at the Milburn in August. Accommodations exceeded our expectations. Location was perfect - short walk to Central Park, and a great neighborhood, but away from the madness of Times Square area. The Continental Breakfast was a nice bonus (get there early but the coffee is fine!). All this for well under $ 200 US per night. The hotel is rated two starts but their service from beginning to end of our stay was definitely 5 stars +. After an 8 hour drive to NYC we parked in a 15 minute unloading zone directly in front of the hotel and went in with our luggage to check in. The clerk noticed immediately that we were being issued a parking ticket. When I ran back out to explain our situation to the police officer the manager followed me out, and when I was told the ticket could not be retracted, the manager took it off my hands. As if that wasn't enough - we'd requested the lowest floor possible (elevator-phobia) and found out our standard room was on the 5th floor, but once again - and without us even asking - the manager stepped in and upgraded us to a suite on the second floor at no extra charge. We would not hesitate to book at the Milburn for our next NYC trip and would recommend it to anyone visiting NYC. Thanks to everyone at the Milburn for service above and beyond. We will definitely be back. One important warning - the Milburn subscribes to a domestic cable TV package that includes an access channel (55?) that broadcasts infomercials late at night for Escort Services and these infomercials border on pornographic. Do not leave your kids unsupervised in front of the TV late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location, but management intentionally overcharges you.”
Reviews.Author: odesStLouis_Mo
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay with my family at the Milburn. However, when I checked out in the early morning I noticed that I had been overcharged for two days. I pointed this out to the cashier and he acknowleged it was wrong and this happened "all the time" but only the general manager could adjust the bill and would do so in a few hours when he came in. I signed the bill assuming that I was dealing with a reputable hotel and the adjustment would be made. It wasn't and because I signed the bill I had accepted the fraudulent charges and they weren't going to adjust them.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RC1Roma
Reviews.Content: Hotel very convenient for families with children. No fancy stuff but everything you need and the price was definitely right (less that 200 usd/night). Location close to CP, subway station, and if you don't mind to walk you can easiliy reach 5th avenue or Times Square in half hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Milburn for one night while in NYC to visit colleges. It exceeded our expectations at every opportunity. The Upper West Side location (Broadway and 76th St.) was very convenient to Columbia University - a 3 block walk up Broadway to the subway station and then a short 5-stop ride to 116th St. Also, the hotel is close to the Museum of Natural History and Central Park. We liked the restaurant options in the neighborhood. It's a nice change from mid-town. Our room was quite spacious - most unusual for a NYC hotel. Our room had 2 queen sized bedsand space for a couch and chairs, as well as a small kitchenette. The continental breakfast served downstairs was a good selection of cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels juices, etc. Free wireless internet throughout the hotel. This is an older property, but we found it to be clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. I can't believe we found this place in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: mamahahn98
Reviews.Content: We had never traveled to NYC, so our research online using TripAdvisor was very helpful in finding the Milburn. We were encouraged by a local friend to stay away from the Times Square/Midtown area to get away from the mayhem and better experience life in a New York neighborhood. I am so glad we stayed in this upper west side location! The room at the Milburn was tiny - this was not a surprise based on everything I read about NYC hotel rooms. We had the studio double - two double beds, a tiny table with two chairs, very small bathroom, and a small kitchenette with microwave, refrigerator, some plates/silverware, and countertop (the kitchenette also had some shelves and ended up being an alternate location for one of our suitcases and belongings). There were four of us - my husband and I, and our two young adult daughters. We did get a pretty good rate through hotels.com (~$137 a night) - expensive for us, but reasonable for New York. If money were no object, we would get two rooms, but..... On the plus side, the beds were very comfortable (I generally have a hard time sleeping in hotels because of the super-hard beds) and had nice linens, delightful pillows. Room was quiet - we did not face out onto the street, but we were near the elevator and did not have a problem. The bathroom had seen better days (heavy on the caulk), but it was clean and worked fine for us. Lots of families at this hotel. They did provide a free continental breakfast - fresh bagels, juice, fruit - but it was often very crowded. Also free wireless internet in the rooms and three computer stations in the lobby for public use. They have a sharing library of books and also videos/video games that can be checked out for free. The front desk staff members were extremely helpful. They greeted us warmly, provided directions and helpful tips, arranged our transportation back to the airport. The only strange thing is that the ice machine and the soda machine are in the basement. The first time I took the elevator down there, I thought it was a mistake - there were housekeeping staff and old mattresses and cleaning supplies everywhere. But there's a tiny room just across from the elevator that houses those items. The neighborhood is wonderful - lots of grocery stores, pharmacies, Filene's Basement and Loehman's nearby, other small specialty shops. Two blocks to the 79th St. subway station - same intersection is where you catch the crosstown bus (M79) that takes you to Central Park and beyond. If you go the other way, you're about 4 blocks from the 72nd St. subway station (there's a Gray's Papaya hot dog place right there that's great). Easy to get to Times Square/Broadway shows. I felt it was very safe. High spots: Manhattan Diner (on Broadway, I think on the corner at 77th?) - wonderful breakfast, get the challah French toast; they also have good desserts. Levain Bakery - just east of the intersection of Amsterdam and 74th - a tiny basement bakery with GIANT warm yummy cookies - the chocolate chip walnut and chocolate peanut butter chip ones were delicious, oatmeal raisin good, too Gray's Papaya (near the 72nd street subway station) - plain grilled hot dogs with mustard and toasted buns. Get the pineapple juice instead of the papaya. Fairway Grocery (corner of 74th and Broadway) - for a Texas girl, this was an amazing glimpse of a "big" New York grocery store. Beautiful fresh produce, extensive bakery and deli. I will say that the deli attendant was yelling at a customer for missing her number being called - a bit intimidating - and the checkout process is fast and crammed. You better be ready and on your A game - this is no Wal-Mart! We bought fruit, veggies, bread, and butter to have in the room for snacks. Also, we got good breakfast sandwiches (bagel with eggs, bacon, cheese) and fresh squeezed orange juice at a hole in the wall place on Amsterdam, maybe called Bagel O? Get the unlimited Metro card and ride subways/buses to your heart's content. I would definitely come back to this hotel and appreciate the fine service we received while there.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Wally4611
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back. I really loved this hotel. It's in the upper West side not far to Central Park and museum mile. By MTA not far to Downtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay w/large, clean, room!”
Reviews.Author: stuseattle
Reviews.Content: Husband, Wife, 10-year-old. We were pleasantly surprised by our recent stay at the Milburn. We chose the hotel because of the location -- two blocks from relatives -- and were a bit concerned about cleanliness because of a couple of reviews. (Had the option of the Belleclaire and the Lucerne, both for a little less money, but the Belleclaire had some construction going on -- light sleepers -- and the Lucerne was a little farther away than we wanted to be.) We checked in in the morning, before the rooms were ready, but wanted to get the king sized bed, which they wouldn't guarantee over the phone, and wanted to see about getting a quiet room. We were given a really nice sized room on the 12th floor. King bed (simmons beautyrest....excellent), big flat screen tv w/cable, desk with free internet, small kitchen w/fridge, microwave and sink, closet w/safe, and a large CLEAN bathroom that had obviously recently been renovated. Everything was clean, there were tons of pillows, and we were really pleased. Contintental breakfast with cereal, a good variety of bagels, muffins, etc . . . all included in the price. There was a DVD player and a VCR in the room and the hotel has hundreds of movies available, at no charge, at the desk! Lastly, in addition to their own exercise room, swimming is available, for free, at the JCC across the street . . . nice place! Also, they have 24-hour room service with the Manhattan Diner across the street . . . less than 30 minutes for delivery and the prices aren't marked up. Let's just say there was nothing wrong with this stay! The staff were helpful, pleasant, and we were pleased. A few thoughts: Because it's summer, we were running the air conditioner the whole time. Since the air conditioner was running the whole time, we barely heard any noise in the hotel. Our room looked out over the inner block, not the street, so there was no real street noise to speak of anyway, however the hotel does use the doors with electronic keys which means they need to be slammed a bit to close. Also, our room was across the hall from the stairs -- doesn't really matter on the 12th floor -- and also right by the elevator. Without the air conditioner, we might have heard more of the people in the halls and other TVs . . . standard hotel stuff but, perhaps, a bit more evident in an older building? Two standard pet peeves: I'll probably write this in every review but hotel designers should be required to spend one week in every room they remodel! 1. The big flat screen tv was great, however it has a BRIGHT blue power light that stays on when the TV is off. Really bright . . . two towels thick bright, if you know what I mean. 2. The completely remodeled bathroom has no shelves. I don't know why this is so common. There's a toilet, with a back . . . put a small shelf there for stuff. There are wrap-around mirrors but only one hook on the door. EVERY traveler travels with toothbrush, toothpaste, drugs, etc. There should always be a place to put them. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New York and staying on the Upper West Side. The restaurants and shopping in the neighborhood are great, you're walking distance to the subway, Museum of Natural History, Central Park, Beacon Theatre....really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: jennt73
Reviews.Content: Great neighbourhood, excellent value and thrilled to see they have extended the breakfast to everyday (last fall it was only Mon-Thurs). My recent stay last week was the third time at the Milburn (which says a lot in itself)....but they seem to have let the 9th floor slide on cleanliness. Maybe it's the next floor scheduled for renovations? We arrived to long, black hair in clumps on the bathroom floor (the toilet had the sanitation seal on it from recent cleaning), the dishes in the cupboard were covered in oil and food, as was the kitchen countertops and light switch. The telephone and night stand had not seen a wipe down in a very long time either. Overall the room was fine (clean linens on the beds, and boy, they are sooooo comfortable), but when we told the front desk about the dishes needing cleaning the room staff only left a clean set on the counter with the dirty dishes remaining in the cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: cmrice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Mlburn for three nights with four young children. Everything about our stay was fabulous. The price (for NY) was extremely reasonable, the location (upper West Side) was very convienent, the room siz (again, for NY) was more than adequate and the staff was friendly and helpful at all times. We were able to book a suite two days before arriving at more than 1/2 the cost we were quoted at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: KYSU
Reviews.Content: Milburn Hotel was an excellent value for NYC.....our room on the 6th floor was large and very comfortable. Some of the decor is dated...but the tv's (flat screen) were current. We had a living room area complete with a sofa which pulled out to a bed. Small kitchenette area (decent size fridge/microwave/sink)...small bathroom (hard to store toiletries). King sized bed was a delight to come back to....slept like a baby. Great pillows too. Room was very clean. Walls were thick...barely heard any noise. No view from our windows...just looked onto some bldg's. Great location....easy walk to subway, grocery store, shopping, decent restaurants, Central Park, etc. Free use of computers (only time we used it was to print our boarding passes...which they did for us). Small workout room. No restaurant in the hotel....but a free bfast was nice. They served mainly bagels, cereal, juices, etc. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler50Plus
Reviews.Content: Instead of an itsy-bitsy room, for the same price at The Milburn you get a suite with living room, separate bedroom and kitchenette, fridge & microwave. Comfortable furnishings, 2 flat screen tv's, roomier-than-usual bath, PLUS the free continental breakfast with wonderful NYC bagels & orange juice. Also free wifi. At 76th & Broadway, we never had to wait for a cab -- nice, quiet neighborhood with grocery store around the corner. In our humble opinion, this is the best value in New York! Very accommodating front desk staff -- never had to wait to ask a question. Printed off our boarding passes for free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rapport between quality and price”
Reviews.Author: society
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from New York having spent a week in the Milburn Hotel.This was our second visit and we were even more pleased.We had a very spacious room on the 13th floor.The room had a very nice balcony with a view of the Hudson river.We were fortunate to have a large bathroom .The staff in this hotel are really friendly and we noticed there seem to be very little change over of staff which we take to be a good sigh.True as other reviews have noted its not the most modern hotel but give me good service and friendly professional staff any time.The location is terrific.A really lovely neighbourhood with everything at hand.I just love the Manhatten Diner across the road.The breakfast in the Hotel is very disappointing but the diner is great and we thought a real New York Experience.The Hotel provides free wi fi which is pretty standard now.We travelled from Ireland and didnt bring a lap top .No need as there are three pcs with internet access for residents use. The are is very well catered for with some excellent delis on Broadway.In particular Zabars is outstanding and just a little walk up Broadway.I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a little peace in the centre of Manhatten.

Reviews.Title: “The Milburn Delivers Again”
Reviews.Author: Ceallaigh
Reviews.Content: We won't stay anywhere else when we visit New York. However, this is NOT a luxury hotel. If you like new shiny Hiltons or Sheratons and don't know New York, you may not like this hotel. But it is a REAL bargain in Manhattan. In an Upper West Side neighborhood, close to restaurants and grocery shopping--and all kinds of other shopping. Three blocks from the cross-town bus or the subway. About 10 blocks from Lincoln Center (if you're a walker, Times Square is only 35 blocks away, but the express subway from 72nd street will take you there with no stops). Two blocks from the park. Quieter than the Times Square hotels and cleaner. The continental breakfast is a nice addition. It's also handy to have a kitchenette, however small. Although there is no restaurant, there is room service through the front desk from local restaurants--and the prices are reasonable. This time, we had a king suite (usually stay in a junior suite) and the space was wonderful. Except for the bathroom. The bathrooms here are infinitesimal. You can barely turn around, no matter what the size of the room. It's an old building, the carpeting is worn, but it's clean. The bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful as ever. The swimming pool and fitness center are not on the premises. Although they say they have laundry facilities, they are industrial-size washers that cost $4 to wash and $2 to dry. If you have a huge amount of stuff to wash, that might be a deal, but if you pack light, there's a laundromat a block away on 75th where a wash is $2 and dry is .25 for each 7.5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: LM77WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the rooms with 2 double beds. The room was clean and the bed was fantastic. The room was dowdy and could use a renovation. The room seemed small and at $230 plus tax a night (breakfast included) I thought it was a bit overpriced. The room was dark as it faced another building. Front desk staff was nice. No hotel parking but they send you to Hertz 2 blocks away where you get a great deal for overnight parking - $25 which for NY is cheap. Location is excellent with good pizza places, etc. nearby. Based on other reviews, maybe my issues were because of the type of room. They only have 1 room per floor with 2 double beds and kitchenette which we didn't use.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's in NYC”
Reviews.Author: starlaOttawa
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, however, I think that the front desk staff were not very informative. The breakfast room was also full as it came closer to 10 a.m. I just wanted to grab a piece of fruit and run, but I was forced to wait in line with the people who wanted to sit and chat over coffee and bagels... Also, there is no payphone in the lobby. If you want to make a call inside (where it's warm), you will have to pay the $1 fee every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: VLF
Reviews.Content: We planned this trip several months ago and originally intended on staying in the Times Square area. However, upon advice from a friend who lives in NYC, she suggested we look elsewhere to stay as we were going to have our 8 and 9 year olds with us. The Milburn, located in the Upper West Side, came highly recommended in a wonderful guide book, New York City with Kids. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, I booked a reservation and have absolutely no regrets. We stayed there for six nights from Dec. 16-Dec. 21, 2008. Our room was plenty big with a tiny kitchenette. The children had a sofabed and my husband and I had a wonderful separate bedroom with a king size bed. There was a bath that had two entrances, one from the living area and one from the bedroom. The counter space in the bathroom is very minimal but there is storage space so you can put your things away when not in use. Besides having the sofabed in the living area, there was also a small dining table. The kitchenette was very small but served the purpose. There is a wonderful market just one block over, Fairway Market, and on a few occasions we bought food items and we were able to eat in the room. The building itself is very charming as it is a converted pre-war apartment building. The staff was helpful, too. We arrived at the hotel on the first night at 2:00 AM and they already had the sofabed made out for our children. The mattress in the bedroom was absolutely heavenly; I slept very soundly each night. The location is wonderful as there is a subway station four blocks one direction and three blocks in the opposite direction. I felt perfectly safe walking to the market alone or with my children. It is a very residential area and it was a treat just enjoying the beauty of all the different old era buildings in the neighborhood. There are several family-run shops as well as chain stores, such as The Children's Place and Gymboree. Getting to the theater district/Times Square on the subway was very easy and took less than 15 minutes. This was my first trip to NYC but I felt very comfortable getting around and plan to return in a few years. I will definitely stay at the Milburn on any future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: kitso4458
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Milburn for four nights in early December, and found it quite satisfactory and a good value for Manhatan. The room was big enough, with a queen bed, clean and well-decorated, with nice bathroom and a fridge and microwave. There were some problems with the TV, but we didn't care enough to call the desk. While it would be outrageously expensive throughout most of the US, we felt it gave good value for Manhattan There was a pleasant continental breakfast offered, which we appreciated. The desk staff were pleasant and professional. We found the hotel convenient to Central Park and the upper West Side, and an easy 1/2 hour to Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Milburn is great value for money”
Reviews.Author: NKSVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: The Milburn was a great find - fantastic location (right near Broadway in the Upper West Side) without the big city noise. Our room was spacious and clean with all the amenities you would find in a three or four star hotel. The service was also friendly and attentive. Would definitely stay here again as NYC hotels tend to be expensive, but by Manhatten standards, this one is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ahmlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn from Oct 20 â€“ 27 this year, relying on the advice of Trip Advisor expert nywhiz. It was the best advice we ever got, and I cannot thank nywhiz enough for telling us about this hotel! We were in Rm. 1405, which had all the modern up-scale amenities: flatscreen TV, very comfortable king bed, video player, a little kitchenette with a big fridge, microwave, coffeemaker. Instead of just a coffee table, there was a small dining table, and that made eating meals in the room easier. The bathroom was spotless, and kept very clean by the hotel housekeeping staff. Breakfast is basic, if you want just coffee and a bagel. But meals were never a problem because the location is ideal: Upper West Side, a very safe place to be, with restaurants all around. For a light lunch, the famous Zabarâ€™s is a 5-minute walk away, and at the corner of the hotel (2-minute walk) is Nickâ€™s, a no-nonsense pizza and burger joint that serves huge burgers and breakfast meals at very reasonable prices. A short block away (5-minute walk) is local market Fairways, where weâ€™d pick up a container of soup and fresh bread, and just heat it up in the room for a late evening meal. The Fairways CafÃ© also serves up good meals, and for the best bagels in Manhattan, thereâ€™s H&H, also a 5-minute walk from the hotel. You donâ€™t need a car if you are staying at Milburnâ€™s. Right at the corner of 76h and Broadway (2-minute walk) you have a bus stop, and the subway is two blocks away (5-minute walk). Since Manhattan streets are just a grid, taking the bus is easy. You may want to purchase an â€œunlimited rides Metropassâ€� from any subway station, and this gives you unlimited rides on both the subway and the buses. I paid $25 for a 7-day pass, a good deal. Central Park is a 15-minute walk away, or you can just walk to 72nd street and take Bus 72 Crosstown. Broadway and all other sites are as easily accessible from the hotel. Take Bus 104 at the corner bus stop (76h and Broadway), and this takes you directly to Columbus Circle/Central Park, the Broadway Theatre District and Times Square. To and from the airport we took a Dial 777 sedan, which is about the same price as a cab. If you book online for the trip to the hotel, you get a $3 voucher which you can use for the return trip. It comes out cheaper than a cab. We must commend the friendly and helpful front desk staff, particularly Adam. The staff was approachable, and would easily answer all our questions from places to eat and shop, to best take-out choices! Having a friendly staff always makes the stay more pleasant. The rate we paid, considering it was close to the New York marathon weekend, was $279 per night (reasonable for an Upper West Side location). I plan to ask the hotel when rates might be lower, because I certainly want to go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice gem on upper West”
Reviews.Author: dmdb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been renovated recently and has updated features. Our bed & linens were great. Each room is a kitchenette so it was fantastic to have a fridge. Our room had a balcony. Not much of a view but a balcony in NY for $279/night! The hotel provided free internet for those without laptops or blackberries. The free breakfast was very simple but a nice offering. The heat was by radiator that only came on when the outside temperature dropped below 50 degrees. That wasn't much of a problem except for the first day when the maid had left the window open. I'd recommend this hotel & we would go back again. Another couple at breakfast said they come to NY often to visit their grandkids. They thought that the Milburn was the best hotel for the price on the upper West side since it had been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Comedy Shave”
Reviews.Author: Ricardodesantaalbana
Reviews.Content: I booked directly on a meeting rate of $235/night including breakfast (this was a busy time just before the New York marathon). The hotel staff were friendly and the room fine, including a kitchenette; the only criticism being the lack of space in the bathroom (making for comedy shaving moments in the morning) and a rather pungent smell emmanating from the kitchen cupboard. The location was excellent and close to Niko's restaurant and the Western brewing company (both on 76th). Central Park is pretty close (5 minutes walk) and Times Square about 30 minutes. Internet was free but slightly on the slow side. Overall a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYC find!”
Reviews.Author: veggiegirl26
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after discovering that most of the tourist area hotels in Manhattan had sky-high rates during September (we expected this would be a slower time but it obviously isn't). The Milburn was a great find and I would certainly stay here again. We have often wondered what it would be like to live in Manhattan and the Upper West Side location of the Milburn offered us the residential feel that we were looking for. The area is very safe and beautiful. We easily walked to Central Park (amazing!!) and visited some of the stores and restaurants in the area. As we explored the city, I realized that I was much happier staying out of the Times Square area. It was busy and garish. I liked staying in a more residential area like the Upper West Side. The hotel is not extravagant. The rooms were average but perfectly fine. They were clean and comfortable and roomy. We had a great experience with the front desk staff. There were a couple of employees that had great recommendations about the area. They were obviously glad to share a bit of their New York with visitors and we appreciated that. The breakfast was decent and a perfectly suitable start to the day. We did have to wait for 15 minutes to get seated because the tables were full of other guests. There was a nice variety of food and the bagels were tasty. If I were coming to New York again, I would be happy to stay at the Milburn.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Milburn”
Reviews.Author: Imshah
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Milburn was excellent. Great price for a New York hotel (250 for a suite) and the room was large, recently refurbished and comfortable. The staff were helpful (provided umbrellas when it was raining) and the hotel had free internet service. We are in NYC about twice a year so we don't want to stay in the tourist areas of midtown. We love the location - two blocks from Central Park, two blocks from the subway, and a great deli/market on the next corner, so we did not have to eat out at every meal (the hotel room has a small kitchen).

Reviews.Title: “good location, small and a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: jdrblue
Reviews.Content: My family of three (2 adults/elementary age child) stayed here for one week. The lobby, public restroom, computer room, and sitting room are nicely updated. I wished they had updated our room the same way! We had a studio, comfortably firm king bed, then ordered a cot to be delivered. The room was small but manageable. The bathroom consisted of a sink and tiny counter space opposite a toilet and shower/tub. There was also a wall phone that I kept knocking with my arm. The baseboards had come off in some spots revealing some ugly spots underneath. I didn't dare open the crooked doors under the bathroom sink. I didn't want to see what was in there (it could've been fine--I don't know). I showered with the door open because it felt so claustrophobic with the door shut. A small refrigerator, sink, and coffeemaker were squeezed in on the opposite side of the bathroom. The maids do not wash dishes as part of their contract. The rooms were cleaned daily and they did a good job. The amount of shampoos/conditioners/lotions they give you is stingy. Unless you ask, they give you one sliver of a soap for the sink AND bath. No shower cap unless you ask, too. The A/C was very loud the whole time. The low-med-high setting controls didn't seem to make a difference although it did keep the temperature cool in the room. I had a hard time sleeping with the A/C on at first but after the second night, I got used to the noise. The front desk staff said the A/C was brand new. That was probably true;' they just didn't mention it was the lowest-end model of the newest A/Cs available. The staff offered to change our room but we decided it was bearable. The hotel gives free wi-fi both in the room and in the lobby. They give you a passcode for thirty minutes of websurfing in the lobby. I don't know if you can get another ticket if you wanted to surf beyond that. We found we didn't need more than that. The hotel offers free use of a brand new pool a few blocks away--this turned out great for our daughter who was tired of traveling. They require a swim cap though; luckily, they had some spares so we didn't have to buy one. The hotel also offers free use of DVDs and videotapes-also good for down time of the kids. The continental breakfast downstairs is offered Mon-Thurs. It's ok--nothing fancy but enough to get you started in the morning. Room service food comes delivered from another restaurant in a brown bag. It was nicely wrapped up in foil on the inside but didn't come on a done-up tray like my daughter had hoped. A washer/dryer are in the basement--I didn't see it but I heard it was pretty spooky down there. It takes something like $4 in quarters to wash. The front desk didn't have any quarters. We decided to take our laundry next door, which they washed/dried/folded for $1/lb. It was in by 9am, out by 5pm. Well worth it. The hotel is located on the upper west side, just three blocks from the subway. The shops and delis give this area a residential feel, away from the busy tourist areas, yet close to museums and Central Park. After the U.S. Open, we walked home from the subway at 2am but didn't feel unsafe at all. Employees were cleaning their shops and sweeping the streets and other folks were walking to their destinations. I'm not used to paying about $200+ for a room but in NYC, this is considered to be on the low end. Good location, but would've liked an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a terrific neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mid214
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Milburn before and are pleased to see that some of the rooms have been refurbished. We called up shortly before our trip to NYC when nearly all the rooms were sold out and ended up with a room on the 1st floor (there are 2) very close to the elevator that everyone uses to go their floor. It was noisy, dark, and the a/c was not adjustable and therefore extremely cold. In addition, the water in the bathroom was lukewarm, both for the shower and the sink. After one night we requested a different room and were moved to the 11th floor and a larger, lighter room that was very comfortable for our remaining 3 day stay. Great king sized bed, lots of hot water, clean, everything worked. For those of you who don't like the continental breakfast or are there on the weekend, spend the extra $$s and go the cafe upstairs at the Fairway or go across the street to the coffee shop at the Viand. All in all, the Milburn is terrific value for the money and the rooms are much larger than most NYC hotel rooms. The neighborhood can't be beat, and this is coming from a former New Yorker who once lived around here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gringomadrid
Reviews.Content: Great location (near to subway stations and central park), very friendly staff, and by NY standards not unreasonable prices.....we loved it! As someone says in an earlier review, the bathrooms are a bit small, but that was our only complaint. And don't forget to check out Big Nick's hamburger joint just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the free breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hugenot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights with two teenage boys. We had a huge kingsize bed in one room and a double sofabed in the other. The rooms are spacious and each has its own TV. However, for four full-sized people, the bathroom is tiny. It could also do with a cupboard/shelf to put toiletries on as they end up all over the floor. The bathroom could have done with a little TLC but it was clean and there was plenty of hot water. The hotel is in a quiet location - vehicles are not allowed to sound their horns in the road outside between 11pm-7.30am - which meant a good night's sleep. We didn't use the kitchenette other than for keeping drinks cool. The breakfast is not great. There aren't enough tables so you have to wait in the lobby until the "breakfast doorman" lets you in. It's very basic and breakfasts in NY needn't be expensive. (You could try Big Nick's Burger Joint around the corner at 2175 Broadway). Note also that the hotel breakfast is only available Monday to Thursday. The reception staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. They answered all our queries and recommended great places to go. As far as New York goes, the hotel was good value for money and we would certainly consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Bit tired but we loved it”
Reviews.Author: bobmcc33
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time looking for accomodation in N.Y. and decided on this one based on previous reviews. Not sure what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a bit tired, but clean and tidy and a very good price. There were 5 of us and we fitted well. The kitchen wasn't great but they brought extra plates etc to accomodate all of us.
