The hotel is well placed and we even walked from there to Times Sq. and back, with a 6 year old. There are some great markets around to stock up on essentials, and a couple of restaurants too. The airconditioners were a bit noisy but blocked out street noise. All in all, we were very happy with The Milburn, and would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill...”
Reviews.Author: travellingmom123
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Milburn for years, but it has gone seriously downhill. The mattress on the sofa bed was described by my daughter as springs in a sheet. The remote for the TV didn't work, and despite many, many promises to fix this, nothing happened. The refrigerator did not work well. Service was terrible. The dishes for the kitchenette were dirty. I needed to request coffee for the coffee maker, which on previous visits had just appeared, and I kept being told that it was on its way. Three phone calls and one hour later it arrived. Every time we needed something the people working there acted like we were bothering them. We will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Powlina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend just last weekend. Before our trip we spent some time looking to optimize the quality for the price. I must say that we were very happy with this hotel and will recommend it to everybody who asks. We got a great rate -- much cheaper than all of the other places we looked into. Our room was clean and spacious and bed very comfortable. Our room had a small but quite adequate bathroom and a small kitchen with microwave, fridge and sink. Everything was very clean and the staff made sure to keep it that way throughout our stay! The service was excellent, and the hotel staff very friendly. The hotel has excellent amenities - a gym, free internet, lounge, free breakfast Monday-Thursday. It is located in the Upper West Side - a charming part of New York City. There are two great grocery stores nearby, it is near Central Park and very close to two subway stations. You will not be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: sharongail
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend one Sat night. Staff very helpful, room was nicer than expected. Had two double beds, kitchenette, large room in clean and good condition. Very quiet. Beds very comfortable but not luxurious. Bathroom was a bit in need of minor maintenance to remove some scrapes and scuff marks but it was clean. Great location. Would stay here again if price remains low.

Reviews.Title: “Bad math ! Milburn Hotel reservation cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: dander53
Reviews.Content: My wife booked a room at the MILBURN HOTEL in New York City on their online website. Their cancellation policy states "72 hours notice" in one location and "3 days" in another. The reservation was for June 25th. Their check-in time is 3:00 p.m. We believed she had until 3:00 p.m. on Sunday (= 72 hours) to cancel. She knew there was a possibility her plans changing and made a point of finalizing some details before 3:00 on Sunday the 22nd. It turned out she could not make it. My wife attempted to cancel the reservation online at 12:30 on the 22nd and the website rejected it. I called the hotel and the front desk said they were "too busy" and would not deal with web-booked rooms (their own website, remember, not a broker). We sent an email to their "contact us" at 1:30 p.m. on the 22nd requesting assistance and never received an answer. My wife called again on Monday and was rebuffed with the new claim that the cancellation had to be three days before the start of the day of the reservation -- e.g. by Midnight on Saturday, (87 HOURS before they would let her into the room.) For a decent-looking hotel the overall service response of their employees was more like the NYC of the 80's than the generally customer-friendly approach of recent years. We were very disappointed (and apparently are out $300 bucks). I would reccommmend a very cautious approach to working with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: dianmichele
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 6 night stay at the Milburn Hotel. We were booked into a room with 2 twin beds, but were upgraded to a one-bedroom suite with a king sized bed and pullout couch when we arrived. It was a great size, and both rooms had air conditioning and their own TV's. The shower had really good water pressure which was surprising to me, but I was glad to have it! We constantly used our fridge and microwave in the kitchenette. When we would bring food or snacks back to the room, we would actually use the microwave as storage and to heat up the leftovers we always seemed to have. This was great because we didn't have to eat out all the time! I brought my laptop with me and the free WiFi in the room was a great bonus as many other hotels charge for this service. The connection is a bit slow, but good enough for anyone's needs. The in-room safe is big enough for passports, money and some other small things. Laptops will not fit in there, but you can get a lot of other things in there! You have to keep in mind that this hotel is definitely older and has some quirks. The main one being the slower elevators. We were on the 9th floor and just before we were ready to go, one of us would go and hit the button on the elevator. The floors aren't that big, so it was easily accessible. Other than that, some of the fixtures are older and a bit dated....but they work! There are no ice or drink machines on each floor either. I think you have to go to the basement to find these, but we just stocked our fridge so we always had cold drinks in the room. They have a really nice continental breakfast downstairs from Mon-Thurs. There are fresh bagels, fruit, cereal, juice, milk, and different dainties to choose from. I always had the bagels with cream cheese, and they were nice and fresh every day. Overall, this hotel is a great value on the Upper West Side. There are 2 subway stops within easy walking distance, and there are tons of shops around...including a few drug stores (for water and snacks, etc), a bunch of great restaurants, and 2 popular markets (Fairway and Westside) for groceries if you need them. It's in a beautiful area and it's a lot quieter than being in Midtown. You can walk to Central Park very easily too. It's just a lot more laid back and not swarming with tourists....you actually start to feel like a local after a while!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Feistygal
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is a terrific hotel for tourists or fairly casual business travelers. I say casual business travelers because there is no business center and the Wifi wasn't very strong in the room I had. On the other hand, the staff was extremely friendly and eager to help on anything from internet to tourist advice. The location--Broadway at 76th--provided convenient access to the subway, restaurants, Central Park, Zabar's, and a great gelato place (Grom) just around the corner. My room (a queen suite) had a fridge and microwave, as well as dining table, dishes and utensils, so provided opportunities to save money by eating in. Complimentary continental breakfast and free wifi made the price an even better bargain. The rooms aren't fancy but my eyes were closed most of the time I was in the room. I wanted a quiet, comfortable, safe place to stay (I am a single woman) and I got all of that. On my next trip to NYC I will probably stay at the Milburn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great on a budget”
Reviews.Author: sk712
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is a great little hotel. I had an "efficiency" apt. with a king-sized bed. It is a really nice room, with a little kitchenette. The kitchenette has utensils, plates, etc. but more importantly, a microwave and a small refrigerator. I didn't use anything but the fridge, but it was available if I'd needed it. The bed was the most comfy bed I've had in a budget priced hotel, and the bedroom section is very roomy, with a desk, a table and chairs, and dresser. There is a TV with a DVD/VCR. The elevator seemed readily available, the staff was super friendly, and they even provide a continental breakfast on most days (not sure what the pattern is, you may want to ask. On Friday of my stay, there was not b'fast.). I did not use the workout room, but it looked well mainained and equipped. There is a nice lobby, with wi-fi. The wi-fi also worked well in the room. You have to ask for a code, but it's free, fast, and easy. It's in a great location, too, for restaurants, shopping, and subway. The negatives are: Small bathroom, loud air conditioner. These are very minor issues. If I were to recomend anything, I'd recommend remodeling/updating the bathroom. Otherwise, it was perfect. I have several upcoming trips to NY planned. I plan to stay at the Milburn. A colleague of mine stayed at a different hotel, nearby, and similarly priced. She was not pleased, and came up to my room to look. She liked my room much better than hers... Definitely worth checking on... but I hope the word doesn't get out too much. I like the fact it was easy to book.

Reviews.Title: “Homey, quiet but chilly”
Reviews.Author: helixdove
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is a solid, good value hotel for NYC. I stayed in a 1-room suite (bedroom with two twin beds, living room, full bath and kitchenette) for $294 per night + taxes. The room was quiet-- a big improvement over the noisier places I've stayed near Time's Square. The doors and walls are thick so little sound was heard from the hallway or adjacent rooms. The room was also large by NYC hotel standards. The weather was on the chilly side- mid 60s. In need of some heat, I found that there wasn't any. The hotel has central heating and it was turned off since it was May. The front desk was kind enough to give me a big, thick, warm bathrobe, but with no heat in the room I found it a bit uncomfortable to sit around. I tried to purchase a heater from the hardware store nearby but they were out since it was May; so just a word to those who are sensitive to the cold and plan a Spring trip, either bring a heater or plenty of long underwear. The front desk was always helpful. Check in and check out were quick and easy. Hot cider was provided in the lobby-- at first I mistook it for coffee. The hotel location is excellent. Two blocks from the Subway and half a block from the bus stop. The area is safe to walk around in at night. I would definitely stay at the Milburn again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a treasure of a neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy1153
Reviews.Content: It seemed that searching for a hotel room under $300 a night, (and WITH its own bathroom) in Manhattan was futile. The message is don't give up. Finally we found The Milburn on 76th & B'way. Perfect. Tasteful, clean,and by NY standards a large room, which was quiet and comfortable. Even had a little kitchenette. True, the bathroom was tiny but hey...it all worked. The staff was gracious and courteous. Did whatever they could to help us and suggested ideas we didn't know to think. Close to Riverside Park, the museum of natural history and the historical museum. An easy walk to Lincoln Center. Easy subway access. A 24 hour room service menu with surprisingly reasonable prices. Highly recommend. You can stop looking now.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Treatment”
Reviews.Author: stonewall4342
Reviews.Content: disgusting treatment - after traveling 20 hours from Australia we were greeted with rudeness and total disinterest and the front manager with the beard started a shouting match that our room was not ready even tho we arrived at 1,30pm and that the bed we ordered wasnot available and who cares! He adopted a couldnot care less atitude. I am a medical doctor and not someone off the streets and have been to New York 15 times in the past 10 years - to be treated like this by this little man. He did us a great favour as we found better accomodation for 14 days where we were treated with professionalism and respect. I would never ever stay at this place and will give my opinion about it to others The best part was that he made us pay for one nights accomadation Thoroughly disgusted with this hotel - never ever see me again for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base For A Great City”
Reviews.Author: PhilipfromUK
Reviews.Content: Our first time to the "Big Apple" family of 5 from London. We had room 602 which is a 2 room suite with 2 big doubles in one room and an OK sofabed in the lounge . Kids had the doubles, we had the sofabed. Rooms are good size and clean, bathroom was OK with no screen issues as mentioned in other reviews, blinds and curtains fine. Also at $299 per night for all of us, is good value. Kitchenette is small, but a useful cubbyhole for tea/ coffee etc Initial problem in that we only had towels & water glasses/ tea cups for 2 and no bedding for the sofabed, but a quick phone call sorted that. afterwards we had very little interaction with the staff until departure, we had an evening flight and had to checkout at 12.00 we were able to stash our luggage in a secure room , gain access to it , and change clothes prior to one of the porters driving us to JFK. We were very happy with the hotel, good position, only 5 minutes walk from the 72 st subway, 10 minutes from central park. Also I must tell you about 3 great places to eat all within 100 yards of the hotel. Nicos: just 30 yards from the hotel on the corner of 76 and Broadway. Really nice meditteranian / greek food, nice atmosphere and not pricey. Breakfast: The Manhattan Diner diagonally opposite Nicos on the corner of 77 and Broadway . Just go there.For a newcomer to New York it was a classic introduction to the great American Breakfast. Finally inbetween the above, next to a small supermarket is "Big Nick's Burger / Pizza Joint" This place looks like a dive from the outside, but step inside and you have a 26 page menu and the best food in the world. So Thank you Milburn and the Upper West Side we will be back. Philip Murgatroyd

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbbyCat4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milburn from 03/29/08 to 04/05/08 in a studio. Check in went smoothly, and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and it was very clean. The bathroom was very small, and I had to be a bit creative in where I kept my toiletries, but it was fine for one person. Also could have done without the phone in the bathroom - I hit it with my shoulder a lot. Friends were also staying at the Milburn in a studio, and their bathroom was bigger, but their room was smaller (still adequate for them though). I loved having the refrigerator in the room - I only used it to store beverages, but still very nice to have. A few minor downsides: ~ The elevators can be very s.l.o.w at times, and were also kind of dingy. We were only on the third floor, so we just took the stairs if we were tired of waiting for the elevator to get there. The higher up you are, the less inclined you would be take the stairs! ~ The rooms have steam heat, and it can be a bit of a challenge to regulate. However, if you call the front desk, they will send someone from maintenance up very promptly to adjust it for you. My room was boiling hot when I got in. Maintenance turned it down as low as it would go, and I still managed room temperature by having the window open most of the time I was in the room. ~ The phone system is old and doesn't work very well...at least it didn't in my room. The few times I made phone calls, I could hear other conversations in the background. I loved the location on the UWS. You are close to a subway station that will get you pretty well anywhere you want to go, and very near to many great restaurants, shops, and grocery stores, yet the side streets are residential and pretty quiet. It's an easy walk to both Central Park and Riverside Park. It's an older hotel, but very well kept. For the price, I would definitely stay at the Milburn again. Loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: JaneMac8
Reviews.Content: We wanted to celebrate our wedding anniversary in New York and friends recommended the Milburn. It was a terrific choice. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are comfortable and clean and the hotel is in a great area. There is also a very good choice of shops around the Upper West Side. The kitchenette was a great bonus, as we were able to buy food at the huge local supermarket 2 minutes away and eat "at home" in our room. Free use of Internet in the computer room and exercise room is an added extra. We were also pleasantly surprised at how reasonable the rates were, as we had heard that New York hotels had raised their prices (but maybe that had something to do with the favourable UK Pound against the US Dollar rate). We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good upper west side hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtnwomanSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: We booked a king suite for four people. The suite was quite spacious and suitable. There were three phones in the suite, two televisions, and a small kitchenette with coffee, tea, and cookies on the counter. The hotel lobby is comfortable, yet gracious, with exercise and computer rooms just off of it. It was nice to have free internet available in the computer room and there was always a computer available. Service personnel were attentive and professional. Room service is offered and provided from the Manhattan Diner close to the hotel. The only problem we encountered were the lack of darkening drapes or blinds to keep out the morning sun. The mini-blinds on the windows did not keep the sun from coming in in the morning. This made it difficult to sleep late. The hotel offers a continental breakfast during the week to its guests. It consists of bagels, muffins, fruit, juice, and cereal. The breakfast was average but a nice touch. The location of the Milburn is close to the subway, many neighborhood restaurants, shops, and grocery stores. Check out the prepared food at Fairways or Zabars. The neighborhood feels like a neighborhood, not a tourist trap like Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “With Repairs, It is Putting on Airs”
Reviews.Author: DiemPerdidi_8
Reviews.Content: More than 12 years ago, when we first began to stay at the Milburn Hotel, it was a little threadbare, and a wonderful find. The hotel offered a rare combination of professionalism and hospitality. The hotel, once a residential apartment hotel, gradually converted the aging rooms, and each year there was a little more of the new as the residents who lived in the hotel left and the hotel charges contributed to the funding of the renovations. The transformation is now complete and the new lobby has a clubbiness, including the books as decorations. The Milburn, with its new/old fittings, is giving itself the new image of a European boutique hotel, complete with hotel staff who screen phone calls for those important enough for the manager (yes, I was actually told that). I'm not a self-important prig, but after more than a decade, it has been nice for the front staff to recognize my name when I've called. I'm not writing to state that the location of the hotel has changed, nor have the rooms suddenly become ill-kept, but there are moments, exchanges with hotel staff, that travelers recognize as the signals that the warmth and professionalism that previously defined the hotel has been superseded by the cold and impersonal. A hotel survives on repeat guests and references. A note to you who have stayed in the Milburn in earlier years, she's a pretty lady now, lost the shabby charm, but she's looking into the mirror instead of looking at her loyal customers.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in New York City”
Reviews.Author: sh3lmart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to NYC for the first time in September, 2007. I did LOTS of research before settling on the Milburn. Many people say that although most rooms in New York are only as big as shoe-boxes, it doesn't matter because you're never in your room. Even so, I can't stand tripping over things and like to have a spacious room, and the Milburn definitely fit the bill. We paid about $310/night, which was pretty much the going rate for hotels of this calibre in NYC in September, one of the busiest months. We had a king suite, and both rooms were very spacious. There were phones and TVs in both rooms, and a phone in the bathroom. As others have noted here, the bathroom was tiny, but I'd rather have a small bathroom than a small living space! The hotel was a bit shabby but it was clean, as was the room. Staff were helpful and friendly, although being as self-sufficient as we are, we had little interaction. Bed was comfortable, air conditioner wasn't TOO noisy, very little noise heard from other rooms. We LOVED the surrounding neighbourhood. Although we went out for a couple of expensive dinners, we didn't want to spend much time sitting in restaurants waiting to be served, so shopped at neighbourhood grocery stores and had our breakfasts and some dinners in our room, The kitchenette was tiny but quite functional. We really liked that when we were out walking, we were in the midst of folks walking their dogs, walking their kids to school, and so on. Proximity to Central Park was great, ditto the subway. I've recommended this hotel to friends, a couple of whom have taken my advice and stayed there on trips to NYC. Nobody has been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “At Last...”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: ...a decent room in New York for less than my mortgage. I live in New York, and I have for more than 25 years. The Milburn is one of the very few hotels here, where you get more than what you pay for. No, it's not a fancy hotel with a set of uniformed doormen and turn down service. Yes, it is in one of the best neighborhoods in this fabulous city, where your room service choices are made up of all the tremendous restaurants in the area that deliver to your suite. It's clean. It's legit. It's convenient. And it's very, very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely , quiet and relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: sineadmonica
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the Milburn hotel for New Years. Lovely hotel, basic but nice. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was based about 30 min walk from times square and about 5 mins to entrance to central park. We found the location great and very easy to find our way around. Our room was great, we had a separate living area/kitchenette to the bedroom. small walk in wardrobe, standard size bathroom.we were at the end of the hallway so we found it very quiet , no disturbances. Maid service only came in when we hung sign on door for maid service which was great - only when we needed it . I would definitely recommend this hotel for standard, comfortable accomadation in new york.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Milburn!”
Reviews.Author: pinaytraveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I, at the last minute, decided to go to NYC for a weekend. I looked for places online and called some of the cheaper places ($150 below/night) but they were all booked. Online, Milburn was around $400/night but when I called them, it was just $310 (with taxes already) for a room with two double beds and kitchenette, bathroom. The area around it, Upper west side was really quiet and clean and felt safe unlike midtown. There was a lot of places to eat near the Milburn. When we entered Milburn lobby, we were impressed by the beautiful christmas decor and quiet elegance. The elevators were old but seemed stable. The staff was courteous and even gave us our room at around 2pm instead of 3pm. The room was clean, with two double beds (they said twin beds!). The decor was a bit shabby but still nice. We had a good stay and even if we went home around midnight, the area around milburn was safe and well-lit. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Milburn!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug56
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent the weekend in New York City and we were so pleased with our stay at the Milburn Hotel. The staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. The room was clean and spacious, the beds were very comfortable, and it was nice to have a kitchen. The location is just perfect - close to Central Park and only a few blocks from the subway for quick access to the rest of the city. The location of the hotel provided a welcome respite after a busy day among the holiday throngs in lower Manhattan. We will certainly stay at the Milburn Hotel the next time we are in New York. Special thanks to Mika!!

Reviews.Title: “Low Key Place to Stay in Nice Non-Touristy Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Trixiebeth
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 nights at the Milburn during a very busy time of year. The entire neighborhood was a bursting at the seams the night we arrived, which was the night before the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Turns out the neighborhood was packed with visitors to see the balloons inflated just blocks from the hotel AND the parade route was just a few blocks from the hotel as well. We were thankful that the hotel had a parking deal with Hertz and that they had room for us. Parking was just $25 a day for hotel guests...going rate for the lots was $50-60 during on the night before and day of the parade. Even though we had complicated logistics (three families with three different arrival times - one family with 5 kids), the hotel reservation staff was very patient and helpful. They even called us back when a larger suite became available. The front desk kept the lobby supplied with hot apple cider which all the guests, us included, happily consumed when coming in from the chilly air. Breakfast is only served Mon-Thurs(except holidays) so I didn't experience any of the food. This is NOT one of the nicer hotels I've ever stayed in, here were the biggest negatives: - our room was a little shabby - the bathroom was very tiny (only one person can fit at a time and even then, some people may not fit at all!) and in need of some work - the elevators could be a little slow - the ice machine is inconveniently located in the basement - there was no newspaper in the AM - thinnish walls, the squeals and screams of the children next door awoke us two mornings in a row, though they did try to be more quiet after we informed them My mother-in-law's room was a little nicer, well at least her bathroom seemed larger and more modern, also it seemed a little airier. We were in room 709, she was in room 706 (both had King beds). All said, I would definitely stay here again even though it is not even on of the nicer NYC hotels I've stayed in. Why? - I enjoyed being in an area that felt more like a neighborhood than a tourist destination. - rooms were decent...not great...but okay - the staff was nice and helpful in a low key way - it was helpful to have a little microwave and fridge in the room, as well as a few dishes

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice at The Milburn.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterfromoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn for 4 nights on our first visit to New York from Australia after looking for a middle priced hotel on â€œTrip Advisor.â€� We got it down to the â€œCasablancaâ€� in Times Square which rated very highly and â€œThe Milburnâ€� and eventually chose the latter. The main reasons were that the "Milburnâ€™s" location was away from the main buzz for a bit of peace and quiet but near enough to everything by subway (72nd St - Express lines) and to lots of places such as Central Park and Zabars by just walking. Also the rooms were much bigger with kitchenette facilities which meant you could knock up your own breakfast, coffee breaks and small meals when you needed it. We were not disappointed and some of the extra bonuses were: 1. Free Internet Room on the Ground floor. 2. Rooms had extra living space, ironing board, 2 TVs, stacks of storage space, microwave and electric stove, free coffee makers and very comfortable beds. 3. Location was just great with a large supermarket just down the block on Broadway for all your everyday needs. The famous Zabars Deli was 5 minutes in the other direction and what must be the best place for hamburgers in New York (Big Nickâ€™s) was 2 minutes around the corner. 4. Can leave luggage before/after check in/out time. Just remember this is not a â€œclassyâ€� hotel and I would recommend that you go for the slightly better standard rooms which have more space and are higher up with a better view. But it does represent excellent value. As anywhere, the service will always depend on who is behind the counter at the time but we always found every-one most helpful. When we checked out to go by private hire car to JFK ($60) we left a small package on the sidewalk with a T-shirt for our grand-daughter from the American Museum of Natural History which we walked to on the last morning. Two weeks later the T-Shirt appeared in the mail back in Sydney thanks to â€œThe Milburnâ€� Hotel. You canâ€™t ask for better service than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great job Milburn!”
Reviews.Author: TexasJim07
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother and sister-in-law stayed at the Milburn for five nights from 9/15/07, based on the mostly positive reviews here on TA. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. We had the studio queen rooms, which were quite adequate for our needs. It's clean and comfortable. The beds were excellent. The kitchenette was very useful. The bathrooms were nice although a bit on the small side. It has a beautiful, cozy lobby with a nice workout room with flat screen TV's off to the side (which I used once and enjoyed). The staff were very friendly and helpful and even took our picture a couple of times. If you have reasonable expectations for what you're paying, as compared to the other upper west side hotels, and you should be very pleased. The best part, however, is it's location and value. It's located on the upper west side close to all conveniences you can imagine. The subway (2 stations) is very close. Central Park, Lincoln Center and the Museum of Natural History are within a 10-15 minute walk. Very good restaurants are within walking distance (try the Manhattan Diner at 77th & Broadway, where George Clooney was filming a scene from his new movie next door while we were eating!). The hotel is a few steps from Broadway and 76th St. is VERY quiet, which offers a welcome reprieve from the hustle and noise of the city. It was the best value, in my opinion, on the UWS based on all the research I did.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, good staff, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: hask74
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an entire week in August, changing rooms four times because of varying numbers of guests in our party. The one bedroom suites are fine, well furnished, quiet enough, good cable TV. The king and queen rooms are also fine, all have a microwave, coffee machine and plates and cups. The best room might be 1002 normally for handicapped persons. it is huge but has a special walk in shower. The staff were always friendly and helpful. the location is fantastic, with Fairway supermarket out the door, the 72nd st Subway whisking you via express trains up and down the city. Nothing in NYC is cheap, but I am convinced the Milburn is good value.

Reviews.Title: “good value, but have reasonable expectations”
Reviews.Author: BBBZZZ
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I stayed at the Milburn this past weekend. The neighborhood is great for a home base - a nice, safe-feeling area, with restaurants nearby, close to subway/bus, walking distance to many fun things. The staff was always sincerely friendly and helpful without being over the top or phony. In fact, the manager went way out of his way to help us with a parking situation that came up. We had three rooms, all next to each other, including one two-room suite. The two regular rooms were small, especially the bathrooms. Reasonably clean, but this is NOT a four or five star property. The decor is a little dated, but the room had a tv, cable, and a dvd player, as well as an iron, ironing board, safe, and a mini-kitchen area. The rooms were VERY quiet - no noise from the hallway was heard or from outside, or the other rooms. The A/C was a window type, and was very noisy (average for a window model, in my experience, but certainly different from the quiet hum of central A/C in a more modern hotel). I would recommend this property based on the staff and value, as long as the expectation going into it is appropriate - it's not fancy, but offers a whole lot for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Longwill
Reviews.Content: After the mixed reviews here, we were not expecting the jewel in the rough we found: a junior suite with renovated bathroom, a functional kitchenette (with plenty of coffee supplied), good range of lighting and I thought a perfectly comfortable bed. They did not have a roller bed for my son the first night but brought one without prompting for him the next nights of our stay. There was a plumbing problem in our bathroom - routine wear and tear, nothing predictable: the serviceman arrived within five minutes of our report and fixed it. Their front desk staff were helpful. Wifi was free. The hotel's position, slightly up a sidestreet from Broadway, makes it quieter than more expensive hotels such as the Beacon or On The Avenue. And the location is wonderful, with The Manhattan Diner quick and tasty for breakfast and so much else close by. We think the hotel is trying hard to give good service, and offers a mildly bohemian but well-run alternative to slightly duller, not much more luxurious hotels. Really good value for money (in NYC), and we look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kbab25
Reviews.Content: The worst customer service on the planet! I booked a room through [--]at the last minute and when I arrived at 2:00 am because of a very late flight my room was cancelled. The front desk representative didn't want to assist me and just kept muttering he was just a clerk. NO MANAGER on duty. It took him over an hour to contact the manager who said he couldn't help me as they had rented my room. Per [--] the reservation was not cancelled and the hotel is not allowed according to their contract to rent out that book of business. The hotel staff was so rude it was like I didn't exist. [--] called the rep on duty and yelled at him but it did no good. To top it all off, [--]tried to tell me that they couldn't get me a room until after 7:00 am because of a policy of rooms being held until then. It took a lot of talking to managers and riding around NY all night before I got a room at 5:am. I will never book at this hotel or use [--]again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: evieb98
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed and have decided it would be my last visit, since the Milburn is an unpredictable mixed bag of a hotel. It is on the Upper West Side, which is a great area and the main reason I stay there. Upon checking in the room this past week it had a very unpleasant odor I think it may be the rugs. We had to open the windows â€“ we were on our way to an engagement so we did not have to stay in the room, and let it air out. The beds which we were told were brand new (although they did not look it) were as hard as lying on a bed of bricks. We had to call the front desk and have them bring up some pads for the beds, we used 2 pads a piece and it helped some. The room dÃ©cor has not changed or been updated in at least the 12 years that I have stayed there on and of f and it is really now old and dated. What was really troubling however was while my sister was taking a shower when she opened the shower door to exit it fell in on her. Thank God she was not hurt and they had some one come right up and fix it, but the front deskâ€™s attitude was very off putting, they did not extend an apology for this incident, but told us in a very chilly manner that if my sister wanted to go to the hospital they would pay for her visit. When a room has not been updated in so long you donâ€™t feel confident in the cleanliness of the chairs, bed spreads etc. Thatâ€™s the last time the Milburn will see us. Iâ€™m shopping for another hotel in the area so if anyone knows of a good one. In fairness the Milburn has good size rooms and we have never felt unsafe there (other than the shower incident). It is really a mixed bag of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Mliburn Met My Needs”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights at the Milburn. It met the basics--clean, quiet, reasonably comfortable beds, mostly dark (see below) but had a number of annoying small problems. It did have a tiny kitchenette, and a phone in the bathroom (actually a bit of an inconvenience; I kept bumping into it because the bathroom is so small) Little problems: There was no box of tissues in the room (though there were paper towels in the kitchenette). There was no clock radio. The TV had sporadic problems changing channels, though I really didn't care much about that. When I sat on the end of one bed it tipped forward, like the bed frame didn't extend the length of the bed. The kitchenette was so tight that the refrigerator door couldn't open all the way so I could get a pizza box in! The hotel booklet promised laundry, but there were no signs to it or at it, a staff member told me that the machine cost 16 quarters. I decided to wait. The only phone book was a 3 year old business-business version. It felt sort of neglected. The only major problem was that the not extremely powerful air conditioner was in the middle of the main window. That meant that on these muggy July nights where I wanted to run the air conditioner I had a choice of being dark and blocking the AC with the drape, or leaving the drape open and letting light in early in the morning. The neighborhood is fine--lively, lots of food shops (some open 24 hours), subways within blocks, the Natural History Museum a few blocks away. I found it more convenient to be where I'd previously stayed in the west 40's around 9th Avenue. Access toi subways and small scale restaurants was better there. Nowadays, anything in Manhattan under $200 per night (this was $159) is considered a bargain, so I guess it was.

Reviews.Title: “Give this hotel a miss”
Reviews.Author: hazel40
Reviews.Content: Hotel expensive although in nice area of New York. However our rooms were very dirty and dowdy, the toilet blocked twice, the TVs did not work and the hotel front staff not at all friendly or helpful. Spoilt our few days in New York. Would never recommend to anyone. How a hotel like this gets business is beyond comprehension

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wulfgar74
Reviews.Content: We searched high and low for a hotel for our first family vacation in 9 years. Let me tell you, the hotel webstie does not do justice to this great hotel. The rooms (1 BR suite) were large and comfortable, the kitchen was small but very usable (saved a ton on breakfasts), the master bedroom had a king size bed with what felt just like our tempur-pedic mattress, and the kids said that the pull out queen bed was comfy. The neighborhood was awesome and safe (with a great market just around the corner and a great place to eat called Nicks that delivers), the hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. When we go back next year, there is not another place that we will even consider. Subway 3 blks away, central park 2 blocks away. STAY HERE, YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dated decor but what a value for a suite!”
Reviews.Author: j3mlee
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Manhattan. We stayed on the eastside for 4 nights then moved to the Milburn for 3 nights. We had a 2-room suite for $254+ tax per night. The bedroom had a king bed and in the living area there was a pull-out coach (very uncomfortable according to my kids!). Both rooms had TV's and DVD/VCR. We had a HUGE bathroom with a separate tub and shower. There was also a kitchenette and a large balcony with a table and chairs. The decor was dated but it was great to have all that space. Our suite was very clean. We had a non-smoking room but were on a smoking floor so the hallways reeked of smoke. The complimentary extras were computers w/ Internet access, DVD's and videos to check out, umbrellas,fitness center, siming pool access. The staff was very friendly. AC units worked great. We loved the neighborhood and frequented the Fairway food market just 2 blocks south on Broadway. There are many shops and restaurants a short walk away. This is an affordable place to stay on the West Side. Get a suite if you want extra room.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: DylanLs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the Milburn. Some staff was friendly, some not so. We had the junior suite, quite spacy with 2 sets of tv - one in the sitting part of the room and one in the bedroom. Unfortunately the one in the bedroom didn't work and i had to mention it 3 times at the reception before they finally went up and fixed it. The hotel is quite old, but clean. The lobby is nice, with fancy toilets. What i really liked is the neighbourhood - upper west and broadway, a clean, safe and quite fancy neighbourhood. As a tourist from another country i really liked being amongst locals, there weren't much tourists in this area. The train station is a short walk away and with the 1 train you're only two stops from Times Square! Be sure to check out the nearby Beacon Theatre, just around the corner. There were some great concerts - Steely Dan was playing when we arrived ! I still regret the fact that i couldn't get a ticket - the only ones available were sold on the streets for a lot of $, and i was warned they were counterfeits. Anyway, we had a great time in NY, and i can recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: ricflo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn for two nights in June 2007. We were part of a group tour, but decided to go a couple of days early. We didn't want to pay the going rate for our group's Midtown hotel, so we decided on the Milburn, and we were very pleased. First, though, the negative: there was a mix-up in our reservations. We had booked on-line throught the hotel's web site in early December 2006. I had occasionally checked the reservation to make sure it was OK. When we arrived, they couldn't find my name at first. Finally, they said we were supposed to arrive in July, one month later. Fortunately, I had brought the email confirmation with me, and after the manager looked everything over, we were given a room that was an upgrade from what we had reserved. So the problem was resolved to our complete satisfaction. Now the good stuff. The lobby is very inviting, with a nice area for seating and relaxing. Our room (a one bedroom suite with a King) was very clean with all the amenities we needed. There were no problems with the AC. The bed may have been the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in. The bathroom is indeed small, but for us that is not a big deal. The Milburn provides as a courtesy what other hotels charge for: use of a computer with internet access and holding luggage in storage are 2 examples. The hotel's location on the Upper West Side is very convenient to subway stops and the neighborhood seems, by NY standards, fairly unhurried and neighborly. There are several restaurants nearby that give discounts or special offers to guests of the Milburn. The hotel staff is very helpful, and recommended a nice restaurant when we asked. Taxis don't often go in front of the hotel, so to get a cab plan to go to Broadway. The Milburn is a great hotel for those staying in NY who don't to spend a great deal of money on a hotel. We absolutely recommend the Milburn and will definitely stay there again when we return. But don't forget to call and verify your reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Marjamarie
Reviews.Content: I am a native New Yorker, but hadn't been "home" in many years. Needless to say, finding a hotel in NY that is reasonably priced is hard!! We came across this hotel in a travel book and called directly to book. There were 3 of us in the room and the total cost, inc. tax, etc. was $818.00 (US) for three nights. We had 2 double beds and a couch that pulled out to make another bed (We didn't use that). There was also a single chair. The room was much bigger than any I have seen in the candid photos. We needed a handicapped accessible room b/c my daughter is in a wheelchair and she was able to move around quite freely and not bump into things! There was a small, but very clean bathroom and also a small, but again clean, kitchen area. Not once did I see any housekeeping staff walking through the halls!! Yet, when we returned from being out all day the room was made up. The staff was very friendly and when we called to ask for extra towels they came right up with them. My only complaint would be that there needs to be a longer loading area. Going in was a breeze, but that was a Sunday. Going out there was a huge truck loading mattresses on and it blocked part of the loading space, and that was in addition to cars going by and one car double-parked waiting for someone--but that's New York!! There is a small fitness center and there is access to a pool nearby (We used neither!!). They are now building a breakfast area off the lobby, but until that is finished there are no restaurants on the property. We went to a bagel place 2 blocks up which our daughter recommended and right across the street there is a 24 hour place called Big Nick's. It is a little hole in the wall, but quite good, and always crowded! Oh, and we had a celebrity sighting the day we arrived. There was a car in front of ours and the man was putting something in the car and it was Richard Kind (from Spin City). We ran into him several times that day walking around. I am not sure if he was staying at the hotel, or just parked his car in front of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Like an apartment”
Reviews.Author: interestedCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical before our arrival, but ended up really enjoying our stay at the Milburn. We rented the one-bedroom suite and it was like having our own apartment. The only drawbacks were the small bathroom and one unfriendly desk clerk, but all other employees were great. My husband has a bad back and the beds were great if you like a firm mattress. The location was fabulous and so close to everything. A wonderful street fair was held over the Memoial Day weekend on Broadway St., just steps from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to others and will definitely stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: The Milburn Hotel does not seem to be a favorite of the local NYC TA experts. I booked it despite their suggestion to book elsewhere. I was extremely happy with my choice!! I had ,what they call a studio room-kingsize bed +small alcove with fridge,microwave and coffeepot. The price was $185 +tax. It faced asmall courtyard and so was very quiet. The room was a good size,furniture modern and bed comfy. The bathroom was tiny but the water pressure in the shower was super! Housekeeping was eager to be helpful. When I didn't want service one day they called to make sure I was OK and to ask if I needed anything. Coffee,tea and Famous Amos choc chip cookies were provided. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant on site ,but provides room service from the 24hr diner across the street. There are 3 computers you can use ,a small exercies room, and an arrangement with the community center down the street to use the pool. I love staying in a real neighborhood where you can make believe you actually live in NY and are not just visiting. I will definitely stay here again and will tell my friends about it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: clydei
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late April 2007. Location is very good just 2 blocks from a Red Line subway stop which among other stops goes to Times Square. There are many good ethnic restaurants within walking distance. We had a one bedroom suite with plenty of room for three of us. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The only drawbuck for us was the temperature of the water in the shower was impossible to regulate, over three days none of the three of us got a comfortable shower. Without a doubt this is as much hotel as you can get in NY City for the money.

Reviews.Title: “impossible to get your deposit back”
Reviews.Author: Emy-7
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel very much the first time we stayed in 2004. So, in 2006 Milburn was our first choice in Upper westside despite the fact that the price had gone way up. We, two families, made two reservations for two rooms and each was charged one night of deposit at the time of booking. Eventually, Only three of us made it to NYC and naturally we cancelled one of the two rooms with the front desk a week before our arrival. We were assured that the cancellation was early enough to get our deposit back. Yet a month after we returned overseas and found out from our credit card statement that we did not get credit from our two reservation deposits. We called and called (using very expensive international phone lines), only to be transfered to the so called "accounting office" where no live person ever picked the phone (every time we called, no exceptions). Our credit card company finally got us one night deposit back, but still now they owe us another night of deposit. And more importantly, they owe us an explanation/apology for totally ignoring our repeated request. We gave up on the money now but we will never never never recommend anyone stay there.

Reviews.Title: “No respect for Non-Smokers”
Reviews.Author: levly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was way too SLOW TO REACT TO SMOKERS on a non-smoking floor! We stayed here for 7 days on a non-smoking floor with no-smoking signs on every door. On our 3rd morning, we smelled smoke in our room and the hallway reeked. I asked the guy at the front desk if he knew about the problem and they said they'd take care of it. That night, at 11:30 pm., once again we had SMOKE IN OUR ROOM and the hallway reeked! Again I called the front desk who later said they had trouble locating the problem. I guess they didn't think it was serious enough in the morning! We both got headaches and had to sleep with the window open and a wet towel under the door. The smokers were gone the next day, but this was ridiculous, not to mention dangerous. Also, the decor is depressing, the mattresses had uncomfortable, squeeky springs and some black mildew on the shower tiles. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home in Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: mencken
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Milburn in 2002, having found it on the internet. We have stayed there nearly one dozen times since. We have always felt the price of the room in which we stay (the same one-bedroom suite, which we always request) IS MORE than fair. We get a living room with a swell view; a clean, outfitted kitchenette, a large bedroom and a clean, attractive bathroom. The radiators have never clinked and clanked. The housekeeping is excellent, the desk help are personable and friendly, and when things are broken or don't work properly, they have always been promptly fixed. The whole establishment is clean, safe, and quiet. Location is superb. We are three blocks from a subway, one block from Citarella (a specialty grocery), Fair Way (a neighborhood grocery), and only one block from Big Nick's Pizza Joint, the best value in quick dining we've found that also is drenched in local color. The management of the Milburn always bends over backwards to offer tips on dining and sight-seeing. If you are expecting Trump Tower amenities, you will be disappointed. If you are expecting top value in a great neighborhood (4 blocks from Central Park, 3 from the Musuem of natural History), you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Firsttimetravelermom
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a last minute trip to New York for New Year's. I booked the Milburn after reading reviews on this forum and was very pleased. When we got there, we were upgraded from a studio to a room with two double beds and the beds were the pillow-top type and were wonderful. The location is wonderful. We were just a few blocks from the subway, but were able to walk downtown the first night without riding the subway. We had a small kitchen and used it to store breakfast food that we purchased at a grocery that was right down the street. My daughter and I felt very safe at all times and never hesitated walking around at all hours. There were a few negatives, but they were not significant. The room was hot, but we ran the air conditioner and that made it fine. The bathroom was a little old looking, but it always seemed clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Olga_R74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Milburn over the Thanksgiving weekend 2005 with our two kids aged 3 and 6 at the time. The room wasn't fancy; however, it was very large by the NYC standards, and we also had a door between our bedroom and the living room where the kids slept. That door allowed us to put the kids to bed early and even sleep late in the morning. The hotel is within walking distance to Children's Museum, American Museum of Natural History, Central Park, Metropolitan Arts Museum. At the same time, the area is not particularly touristy, so you can feel like a real New Yorker strolling down a tree lined street to get your homemade breakfast at a local restaurant in the morning - I would recommend Alice's Tea Cup and Sarabeth's. There is also a perfect family friendly restaurant called Niko's just across the street. The food is good and not too expensive. The kids loved getting a baloon after dinner. We were so happy with our stay that we are coming back this Thanskgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDM
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Milburn was for business, and the location was great for a good night's sleep before an important day. The neighborhood is quiet, and in the morning the taxis come almost nonstop in front of the hotel. The rooms are somewhat tired, but nothing bad. The front desk staff are marvelous. They do not have a restaurant in the hotel, but room service is provided by the plethora of ethnic restaurants in the immediate area. If you want to get away from the noise and lights of the more touristy ares like Times Square, this is the place to go. I heard absolutely no street noise. If I had been staying for more than one night, the full kitchen would have come in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: kp123456jk
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. No luxury, but a great deal for NYC standards, conveniently located, and quiet. Suites with a living room and a bedroom, microwave and refrigerator. One disadvantage was a lack of a restaurant in the hotel, but there are plenty around.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Tripp2
Reviews.Content: To Be Short, Great location, but had to be moved twice within a week,. The first room had a bathroom that my shoulders could not fit into. The second had ROACHES, and every carpeted inch of the last room squeked. The roaches were the most disturbing. Eventhough staff said they had never had that problem before, I think we noticed a couple of roach motels in the room. On the positive end, staff was courteous, and moved us to new rooms when we had problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MeInSF
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights and loved our experience: wonderful location location near Fairway/Natural History Museum/great restaurants, friendly staff, comfortable/roomy rooms with a great kitcheonette to keep b'fast/snacks cool -- all in all, a hidden jewel and highly recommended for families.

Reviews.Title: “great base for family visiting NYC”
Reviews.Author: DCAnde
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Milburn with our 2 year old and were pleasantly surprised to be booked in a very large suite for $194/night. Size of a good studio apartment. Kitchenette with fridge and microwave and small sink. King sized bed, good quality crib was set-up when we came in complete with nice bedding. Small dining table, fold-out sofa, nice view. Bathroom fairly recently renovated with two sinks (although somewhat cheap materials). The location can't be beat and, although not cheap, it's a good deal for NYC. Very clean. Room had DVD player and you can borrow movies free of charge. Other relatives also stayed at the Milburn (family wedding) and our suite was by far the nicest. Some of the other rooms were pretty small, some had super tiny bathrooms. But, again, this is New York. Downsides: they were not able to accomodate early check-in, we were not offered any help with our many suitcases, elevator is excrutiatingly slow, AC is noisy window units. Shower went hot and cold a lot. But these are all fairly minor problems. I would definitely stay here again if traveling with kids or older people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For Our 4-Person Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Milburn for 4 nights in mid-June, after staying the previous 3 nights at Embassy Suites by Ground Zero. Both my kids preferred the Milburn, for a variety of reasons. The first was location...just 1/2 block off Broadway and the subway system. Just a 15 minute walk from the Museum of Natural Sciences. It was also much closer to grocery stores, diners, etc. It was also $100 cheaper per night. If we had to do it over again, we would have stayed at the Milburn the entire time. I don't understand some other reviewers who said they didn't like the Milburn, but stayed there for 4 nights, anyway! Hey -- you can always change hotels if you don't like one!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: IrishRick
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed at the Milburn for three days in late June. This hotel was clearly a surprise. We had adjoining one bedroom units on the 14th floor. Living room was adequately sized with a sofa, overstuffed chair and table with 2 chairs. Kitchenette with coffee maker and microwave. Bedroom had a fulll dresser and lots of closet space. Good, firm beds. Bathroom was small but had a great shower. 2 TVs with DVD/VCR in living room and VCR in bedroom. Window A/C in living room and bedroom. Great location just off Broadway at 79th on the Upper West Side. And, it was quiet! The friendly staff answered all our questions. The hotel provides self-serve washers and dryers after 5 pm. The only minor annoyance was that our unit needed new mini-blinds. They were broken and could not be closed completely. Certinly not a deal breaker. At just over $200/nite, I'd go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Actually a Decent NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Although the staff were not exceptionally friendly, they were friendly enough, and more importantly, they were always prompt whenever I needed anything. Our room was clean and actually really spacious for a NYC hotel (we had a 1 bedroom suite). I would definitely recommend it for families with kids. I stayed there with three little kids, and thought it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't risk it - pay the extra for a real hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Milburn Hotel and to say I was terribly disappointed is an understatement. I am by no means a 4 star traveler so I am used to staying at moderate establishments. This isn't even close. Let me start with the positive, the staff is great as is the neighborhood. The Upper Westside has some great finds and Central Park is really close. They had great restaurant suggestions ( Both Citrus and Coppola's restaurant (79th and Broadway) were fantastic) and the staff from front desk to maid service were always polite (which in NYC is not always the case). This, however, is where the nice comments stop. We made our reservations through their site over 4 months ago yet were put in a room right by the elevator on the second floor. They are doing construction which meant banging on the walls all day. Our view was of construction workers and all the garbage that goes along with that. The air conditioner is a windowbox so all the dust from their work blew directly into our room. We asked to move but were not accommodated. The plumbing in the bathroom backed up (gurgling from shower, sink and toilet), the towels were crunchy, we saw a cockroach and the decore is right out of 1982. Clearly we were not in an updated room. For this, we paid over $200 a night. They call it "European" but in reality, I'd say it's more rent by the hour. Before choosing this place, I read all the reviews on Trip Advisor which overall were pretty good. Unfortunately, the experience I had totally contradicts what I read. If you are looking for a bed, by all means the Milburn Hotel will be fine but if you are looking for just a little more, LOOK ELSEWHERE!

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations and more!”
Reviews.Author: viccity
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milburn for 9 nights from May 30 to June 8, 2006. Originally booked a king studio suite but after one night decided to upgrade to a one bedroom king suite. The extra cost (nominal) was well worth it. The studio was adequate but we found it difficult to sleep with the air conditioner on in the same room as we were sleeping and the space was a bit tight. By moving to the one bedroom we could run the air conditioner in the living room and have a quiet yet cool sleep in the bedroom and we had at least double the space. The front office staff had no problem accommodating our change. We found them friendly and helpful throughout our stay with recommendations for places to eat as well as directions. The cleaning staff were friendly and efficient as well. The rooms do look a bit tired but everything was very clean and the bed comfortable. Had some rain during our trip and the complimentary umbrellas at the front desk were very welcome. The location is great with the 72nd Street station just 3 short blocks away and the 79th three blocks the other way and the bus running along Broadway just steps away. Lots of dining options in the area as well as shopping. We had breakfast in our room in the a.m. as there is a fridge, hotplate, microwave and coffeemaker in the room. Picked up fresh croissants, muffins, juice and fruit from the nearby Fairway Market or the Citarella Deli on the corner. Niko's Taverna or the Manhattan Diner are within half a block and both serve good food, moderately priced. Would definitely stay here again and can't wait for our next trip to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Liked The Milburn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reissussa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Milburn Hotel during Easter and found it to be nice, quiet and clean hotel. The decor was a bit out-dated, and our bed was very hard (we like hard beds, but this one was a bit too hard even for us) but everything else worked just fine. Our room was much larger than I expected, kitchenette was very handy and cleaning staff efficient. Location was great too - we just loved Upper Wes Side! It was lively but not restless. And I have to admit that for us very blond Scandinavians it was nice not to stand out from the crowd as we definetly would have in some other parts of New York. Easter was very warm, so we ended up spending a lot of time in Central Park which was just a short walk away from the hotel. 72th Street subway station was also very close and so was West Side Market (we liked it better than Fairway since Fairway was always so crowded). I would stay at The Milburn again. But I have to admit that if I had more money to spend I would go to some place much fancier... Like the four star hotel Ansonia we cold see from our window :) But for us budget travellers The Milburn Hotel was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Milburn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is a good deal for NYC. The location is very good. Fairway Market is very close and has an excellent selection of food. Our room was very clean and spacious. We found it to be very quiet. The kitchenette is a nice plus as prepared food can be expensive in the City. Our only "problem" was the last night we were there it was very warm and we found our room to be too warm when we returned late at night from a day out. The hotel staff were unable to figure out what was wrong with the AC and so we had to open a window. Not a big deal, but a bit of an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: imcolorblind
Reviews.Content: The Milburn turned out to be exactly what we needed -- a clean, roomy place in an excellent location at a very competitive price. We were there for 4 nights (3/22/06 to 3/26/06). We were very, very happy, and would not hesitate to stay there again. We too had "hot" rooms, but we simply turned down the radiators, and eventually turned them off! The room also had lots of windows, so we could easily open them when we needed to cool things down a bit. We also noticed that the dishes weren't washed, but that wasn't very important to us. We were there with our 9 year old son, and he loved having the pull-out couch and living room to himself at night (perfect for a child, but I wouldn't want to sleep on the pullout myself!). Although we did not need to make much contact with the staff, we found them to be perfectly helpful and friendly. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Need to do better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was OK although the heater was noisy, the kitchenette was very poorly appointed, room service did not clean cutlery or crockery, the sofa bed was very uncomfortable and the phone did not work. We were very dissapointed with the lack of courtesy and assistance from the front desk staff. We found them to be surly and unfriendly. We wondered if we were imagining this but we witnessed other guests receiving similar treatment. Expressions such as 'please', 'thank you', 'can I help you?', were non existent. In the end we decided not to bother complaining. We suspected our comments would fall on deaf ears or would be greeted by further rudeness. Frankly, we were pleased to be out of there. Our time in NYC was fantastic, our time at The Milburn was not.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: aikomule
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here during the week between Xmas and New Years. I was going to see Gov't Mule at the Beacon and the girls were going all over New York The location is perfect, the rooms were very nice and the staff was wonderful. They helped map out our day trips and were always very professional. The only problem was the heat was always too high! They tried to fix it, but there seemed to be little middle ground. I'll take too much heat in NYC in the winetr if I can stay at this moderately priced, kid friendly, perfectly located hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Audrey63
Reviews.Content: I found the Milburn to be excellent value for money and I'd definitely stay there again. My room was clean, comfy, reasonably-sized, with kitchenette, iron & ironing board, TV and DVD/video player - you can actually borrow videos/DVDs from the front desk to watch in your own room, if you're tired from seeing all the New York sights. Bathroom was small but pristinely clean. My corner room was quiet, no noise from the street or from other rooms. You can check your email for free at the computer terminal at reception. The staff were polite and efficient, though the quality of service can be variable. I love the Upper West Side which is less crazy and feels warmer and safer that midtown Manhattan. No shortage of good restaurants and cafes in the area, there are supermarkets (Fairway's, Zabar's etc) nearby, banks and major shops too. Lincoln Center, Central Park within walking distance, and subway station is only a couple of blocks away. Crosstown buses are also a couple of blocks away, useful if you're going over to the Museum Mile. Don't expect the luxurious trappings of the big hotel chains, but if you're looking for a clean and comfortable room to stay for a few days or even a week, I'd definitely recommend the Milburn. Rooms can be booked through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for visiting NY”
Reviews.Author: Visitor63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Milburn for 4 nights in late November with my mam. We were over from ireland on a shopping/sightseeing visit, and I found the Milbutn excellent. I booked it because of the reviews it got on this site, and also because it was so reasonable! It's in a great location, about a 35 min walk through Central Park to Fifth Avenue, and there is also a subway stop two blocks away. The room was lovely, not huge but very nice. And no sign of cockroaches! It was very clean, the television was quite big and the kitchenette is very handy. The Milburn is just off Broadway, and there are a good number of shops close by, including the Body Shop, Urban Outfitters and a very nice supermarket/deli. We weren't too keen on the Greek restaurant on the corner, but there are some nice Italian restaurants close by. The staff were very nice. Not too in your face, but extremely friendly. We went to the reception with several queries re Broadway tickets, restaurants etc and they could not be faulted. Previous reviews said that the decor isn't great in the Milburn, and that is true. But its also not shabby and is very clean. All in all, I will be staying at the Milburn again and am very pleased we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and toasty in Dec”
Reviews.Author: underwayatlast
Reviews.Content: Fortuanately a snowstorm caused major cancellations so we got to stay a block away from my sons apartment. Our 14th floor suite was large, very clean, warm, and quiet. The staff was cordial and breakfast & dinner room service was great. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly, low-price hotel.”
Reviews.Author: elm01au
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Milburn for three reasons: 1. the price, 2. the fact that they had suites and 3. reviews on this site were mostly positive. It was the right choice. The hotel is aging but I have stayed at places much worse. The rooms were large and the kitchen of our suite came in very useful during the week we stayed in New York. The free use of the internet in the lobby came in useful and if I had more time their library and pool access would have also been useful. The location is also great. While you arenâ€™t as close to all the attractions the subway is only a short walk away and since its so close to Broadway we never had a problem hailing a cab. The main reason that the location was so great is that Upper West Side isnâ€™t really a tourist area. So instead of all the shops being tourist orientated (i.e. full of postcards and other souvenirs) you get some great businesses nearby. In particular there are a couple of great supermarket/delis nearby where we often grabbed something for dinner â€“ heating it up in the microwave in the hotel suite. The staff were also helpful and friendly. Sometimes however it can be difficult to get them to understand what you want. When I released I might have broken my arm one morning (tripped walking back to the hotel the night before) they referred me to a great doctor nearby. However it took ten minutes just to get them to understand that I didnâ€™t want to go to the ER but to a doctor and then another five minutes for them to find the doctor they had listed in their reference information. Overall I would recommend this hotel. The positives of our stay more then outweighed any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: NonanoN
Reviews.Content: Excellent, this is a gem. Friendly staff. Clean. Great location. Heat can actually be turned off (this was a complaint by another reviewer who apparently didn't find the valve).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Star015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Milburn for 8 nights and found it was everything we needed. The staff are polite and helpful, I had asked a 101 questions via email before arrival and everyone was answered. The neighbourhood is great, not too many beeping taxi horns (you'll know what I mean when you get there!). Really easy to hail a cab, lots of shops, restaurants, etc in area. We stayed in a one bed suite with our two sons, we had a large bedroom and a large seperate lounge with a pull out double sofa bed, both rooms had a telly and video/dvd. Borrowed a playstation and games from reception. Has a small kitchenette with full sized fridge, microwave and you can ask for a hotplate so you can make a cup of tea. The bed in the bedroom was huge and very comfortable, the bathroom is small but adequate, lots of storage space in the hallway and bedroom. You may find a posher hotel, you won't find a more welcoming, unpretentious one then this, we weren't disappointed. Contact the hotel before booking as we got a good discount on the nightly rate because of the length of our stay. Would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Holiday location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was a bit nervous especially with the staff supposedly being rude. But as in most cases staff respond to how you treat them. They were very friendly and helpful and I personnaly cannot fault them. The Rooms were clean but sometimes a little too hot for me but a good size and all you need. Bathrooms are small. Excellent location for Central Park with a Subway two blocks down.Breakfast at Nikos 50 yards from the hotel which has excellent food at a good price. Personally I was impressed by the staff and the Hotel. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every dollar!! Superb!”
Reviews.Author: elevation
Reviews.Content: Based on the favourable reviews on TripAdvisor,we booked our room at the Milburn and were not disappointed at all. Large,clean rooms, friendly service from the staff. We had a junior en-suite at the 12th floor, with fantastic views. The kitchenette,microwave,fridge were in the "living room", which further included dining table, couch and large TV. In the bedroom, we had more than enough space, including a small walk in closet for clothing. Again a nice TV,so we could watch SpongeBob or CNBC in the morning. Bathroom wasn't large, but well maintained,clean soft towels every day. Can't understand why people complain about this hotel; no there isnt a fancy lobby, or a hotel bar, but that's not the main reason for me to stay in a hotel anyways. Main thing is a place to stay, a good bed, decent shower,and good location. Well...guess what...The Milburn delivers on all fronts. Upper West side is just 10 minutes away from Time Square, with the 1 or 2. Subway is 4 blocks away (5 minute walk) on 72th street. Breakfast is available at Manhattan Diner, just across the street, $15 for 2 persons! Dinner is okay at Niko's, also across the street. Already mentionned in other reviews is Fairway market, large selection of fresh products; vegetables, meat,bread,take-away dinners. We paid $215 a night, which I think is a steal, this timemof year, and considering the neighbourhood. I compared many prices of similar hotels on the UWS or Midtown, and the Milburn was always the most attractive one,also based on the reviews. Book the Milburn, you wont be disappointed! Stefan Laszlo The Nethelands

Reviews.Title: “OK, Very Budget, Quiet Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Milburn is NOT a luxury hotel. If you're looking for a place to sleep, take a shower and a friendly staff, then Milburn is a good hotel. My family of 4 visited NYC Nov 23-26. NYC is packed throughout Thanksgiving weekend so we were lucky to even have hotel accomodations. We stayed in a corner suite on the 3rd floor. Our 2 room suite with kitchenette was spacious, but the decor was very, very dated. The wallpaper was peeling, the paint was chipped on trim work and there were scuff marks on the walls. The rooms were very warm. We couldn't regulate the heat. In the front room the window A/C unit wasn't properly installed in the window. The small gaps around the A/C unit allowed outside air get into the room. Maybe that's why the heat was so high in the suite. The Milburn is located on the upper west side of Manhattan. The nights were quiet so we could sleep peacefully. Good markets, the Natural History Museum and the Thanksgiving Ballon Blow-Up are very close.

Reviews.Title: “The Milburn did nicely!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and two daughters, aged 17 and 20, were at the Milburn November 9 to 14 and enjoyed our stay. Did not see any roaches, and while a touch shabby, our one bedroom suite was comfortable. Lots of clean towels and the bathroom was a decent size, lots of mirror space. Little things could be improved, such as replacing mattresses on the twin beds (the girls said they sagged a bit); better heat regulation (too hot for us most of the time); and a more consistent water temperature (all of us found the water suddenly went cold or suddenly went too hot. For us, the location was ideal and we stopped at Fairway Grocery nearly every day to stock up on snacks and ready to heat meals. Fairway is two blocks away on Broadway with a tremendous selection including organic and health food floor. The famed Zabars is just another few blocks north on Broadway -- yummy blintz! Great shopping closeby, and we highly recommend the lemon tart at the Columbus Bakery, Columbus and 82nd. 30 minute walk across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art or the Guggenheim. A great place to stay if you want quiet while you save money for other things that matter more than luxury accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “reservation lost!”
Reviews.Author: charliedog1961
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation to stay here. The previous day, not sure if my trip was going to be called off, I called the hotel to ask about cancelling the room. I was told that I could not cancel. One hour later I called again to say I did not want to cancel, and asked if my reservation was still in place. I was told that it was. When I got to the hotel, my room had been given away. My first phone call had been recorded in their log; my second call hadn't. This oversight caused me a great deal of inconvenience and should have been avoided. I can't review the hotel, obviously. The neighborhood is nice.

Reviews.Title: “A little shabby/great location/good price/large rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaineIzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite on the 14th floor. For the price, the size of the room is enormous--actually a bedroom and sitting area. We have friends in the city with smaller apartments. The room was fairly clean, the bathroom could have been cleaner. The fixtures and bathroom are a bit on the shabby side.
