The front desk is fairly helpful, and you can stash your bags before you check in and after you check out easily. There is not much of a lobby, and there's only one bathroom in the lobby, hidden in the area where luggage is stored. One computer in lobby for checking email. Wicked slow elevators. Really great location for subways and busses, just a few blocks to Central Park. Several wonderful restaurants and grocery stores nearby. The little kitchenette in the room was nice. Microwave, tiny coffee maker, dorm-sized fridge. We paid $215 which is average-to-economical in the area. Overcharge for local calls (.75) and even toll-free and credit-card calls cost. We have stayed at the Excelsior (good rooms, horrible, horrible staff), The Lucerne (wonderful all around but no longer moderately priced) and Comfort Inn Central Park West (room tiny even by Manhattan standards). The Milburn is a good spot if you aren't too fastidious. NY isn't really about the room, anyway, so stay here if you want a great, quiet neighborhood and aren't in need of swanky surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: arr6th
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Milburn for a 3-day weekend. We chose this hotel based on the many positive reviews we read posted here. Started to get concerned when the last few posts were turning up negative -- regarding bugs, etc. Turns out we had nothing to worry about. This hotel was terrific. We knew it would not be fancy or chi-chi. The decor is typical americana -- kind of what you would get at a best western. What we got was great value for the money. It is an older building, but very well kept. Our room was large, immaculately clean, and had two windows looking out the back of the building into a tree canopy. The TV was huge, the kitchenette was clean and useful. The bathroom was small, but very modern. Thankfully, we did not see any bugs in the room/kitchen/bathroom. Every person we spoke with at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. The neighborhood cannot be beat. Lots of markets, bakeries, restaurants, coffee bars, etc. Any and all amenities one could ever need. The only minor criticism I have is that the shower water was a bit hard to regulate -- someone else posted this same criticism also. However, I have found this same issue in hotels the world over and it's not enough to keep me from staying at a particular place. This hotel is a great value for the money -- especially in New York. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Liked my staying there.”
Reviews.Author: toel
Reviews.Content: we were three ladies- me and my sister and my niece who is 26. We liked our staying there. The location was o.k. Near the a subway at 72 th st. and and feeling safe to walk even late at night. Once I know more about New York city this days' I would prefer next time to stay nearer to the Village. The loacation is near central park and I enjoing a daily walk. The rooms are big and comfortable. The saff were polite and helpfull. It was very comfortable to be able to use the kitchenette. we enjoy eating fresh vegtables and frutes and do not like heavy food and fancy restaurants. We discover a lot of nice happenings in just walking in the nighborhood at different times and hours. Tere were croaches - small. two of them. Not very nice but not that awul.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible so stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was full of cockroaches. The airconditioner barely worked. The staff was unfriendly. The bathroom was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: dlepsg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location. However, the front desk staff was very rude to me in my attempt to resolve a misunderstanding regarding a mistaken booking of two rooms when I only needed one. They made no attempt to resolve the matter in a fair manner. They simply said they had no authority in the matter and referred me to a manager who would not return any calls. We were in NYC to attend a wedding and the location of this hotel is good. However, the room we had was very small, the furnature was worn, the toilet ran constantly, the shower was very difficult to regulate in terms of temperature and there were bugs in the room. The staff was so unresponsive that it seemed pointless to ask for any assistance with these matters. I would never stay in the hotel again and would never recommend it to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: The Milburn Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 242 West 76th Street, New York City, NY 10023
